Description:
What is Mastodon and the Fediverse?

Mastodon is free and open-source social media network not owned by a single company. It's used by millions. More about Mastodon on joinmastodon.org. Check out the live stream and read more about the Fediverse.

Summary of Mementomori.social

Mementomori.social is a general purpose Mastodon instance established in November 2022, hosted by a Finnish full stack web developer and Chief Technology Officer Roni "Rolle" Laukkarinen with over two decades of server and web experience. The instance is financially backed and sponsored by a Finnish web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Despite the name, the nature of this server is NOT temporary, on the contrary, it is thoroughly optimized both financial- and administration-wise and is constantly worked on to be as future-proof as possible.

Mementomori.social supports the development of Mastodon and the Fediverse and is pro-Threads and pro-Bluesky federation and ActivityPub integration. You should know that, if you have anti-capitalist or anti-commercial objectives with social media.

This instance allows:

  • Regular, personal user accounts
  • Anonymous user accounts (with a reason)
  • Companies
  • Associations and organisations
  • All languages
  • Politics
  • The upcoming Bluesky bridge Bridgy.fed
  • Threads.net
  • Indexing of public content and profiles (please read our Privacy policy)

We welcome users all over the world, but the majority of users are Finnish as the server is based in Helsinki, Finland.

Features

Full feature listing here.

Software

We use a modified fork of the nightly version of Mastodon (main branch on GitHub). We follow mastodon.social which is the instance of the founder of Mastodon, Eugen Rochko, to guarantee the stableness of the server. No untested and unintended commits are used in production environment.

The current version and modifications with full source code can always be found in the footer (bottom right on desktop), see the View source code -link.

The server software is always patched to the most secure version and no unsafe modifications are used.

Recommended mobile apps

  • Mona for iPhone
  • Ice Cubes for iPhone
  • Mammoth for iPhone
  • Moshidon for Android

Code of Conduct

For the rules scroll down to bottom.

This Code contains the rules and principles for participating in the Mementomori.social community. The Code is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document and based on Mastodon.world's work (thank you guys).

Goals

  • Support open and free social web movement, open source and the development of Mastodon, Fediverse and the ActivityPub protocol.
  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristic.
  • Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each other’s successes.
  • Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content and from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

Principles that guide us

  • We are not a free speech zone. This code of conduct lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything that violates these rules or principles and remain a member of our community. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.
  • Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome here. We will moderate accordingly.
  • This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you choose to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.

Rules for posting

The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in Mementomori.social

  • Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about inflammatory subjects at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases, but it is never acceptable to post inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning.
  • Do not post any type of nudity without a Content Warning.
  • Do not engage in name calling, ad hominem attacks, or any other uncivil behaviour. Criticize ideas, never people.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful, or just don’t like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from mementomori.social when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times, or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in suspension of the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isn’t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for Mementomori.social, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or otherwise are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the discretion of the moderation team, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Longevity

The admin of this server has been committed to keep it running ad infinitum and can control it as long as he lives and breathes, his lifetime expectancy says up until 2067. After that it's up to people who decide whether to respect the notion on his will that says mementomori.social should be kept running.

Announcements & updates

The admin of this instance is committed to be as open as possible about the changes. Each user is accepted and welcomed. Please see the hashtag #MementoMoriSocial.

Help & getting started

Read instance wiki at help.mementomori.social.

About

Mementomori.social is a Mastodon instance hosted by a Finnish web developer Roni "Rolle" Laukkarinen with two decades of server and web experience. The instance is financially backed and sponsored by a Finnish web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Memento mori is an artistic or symbolic trope acting as a reminder of the inevitability of death, but it also refers to a various topics like a certain type of stoic philosophy of peace and acceptance, visual art, literature, architecture, music, culture, history and equality.

The server name origins from a stoic latin phrase "Memento mori" and is originally sparked from the thought "what happens to the instance if something happens to the owner(s)". The admin of this server is a stoic-ish person who believes we never really "die", nothing is permanent and at the same time everything is. We carry on. If not in person, then in someones mind, until the universe (and the Fediverse) is here no more. “Why should I fear death? If I am, then death is not. If Death is, then I am not. Why should I fear that which can only exist when I do not?" ~ Epicurus

"It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it. Life is long enough, and a sufficiently generous amount has been given to us for the highest achievements if it were all well invested. But when it is wasted in heedless luxury and spent on no good activity, we are forced at last by death's final constraint to realize that it has passed away before we knew it was passing. So it is: we are not given a short life but we make it short, and we are not ill-supplied but wasteful of it… Life is long if you know how to use it." ~ Seneca

Mementomori.social contains plenty of modifications like Mastodon Bird UI, bigger link previews, show counts in comments and so forth. By being here you accept things are prone to changes.

What's the catch?

There is no catch. Mastodon should be free and available for everyone. The instance was born in Fall 2022 after Elon Musk purchased Twitter, but even before that Rolle had followed the development of Mastodon with a keen eye. Welcome! This instance won't probably be the most biggest in the Fediverse, but there's always room for one more user.

Closing remarks of this About section

General mental health and safe space are important to the admin of Mementomori.social. Please be respectful towards other people whenever you can. Glad you're here. Thank you for reading this.
Short: Mementomori.social is a social media for mortals. We connect with the Fediverse, used by millions. This instance is backed by a Finnish company, digital web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Description:
Benvenuti su Senigallia One!

Mastodon è un social network non commerciale, federato e decentralizzato. Senigallia One è una istanza italiana autogestita dalla community

Perché iscriversi a senigallia.one

senigallia.one è una istanza generalista, indipendente, etica e libera. Vogliamo essere una community felice e benevola, ma anche competente e divertente. Per questo ci siamo dati una policy rispettosa dei dritti di tutti, per costruire insieme una community sana e priva di comportamenti tossici. Ti consigliamo di leggere questo documento e le regole dell'istanza per capire se senigallia.one è il server che fa per te. Se non ti riconosci o non condividi le regole di questa istanza puoi cercarne un'altra che rispecchi di più la tua sensibilità o i tuoi interessi. In alternativa puoi sempre creare la tua istanza (questo è il bello di Mastodon) e rimanere collegato all'interno della federazione.

senigallia.one rispetta la tua privacy

  • Mastodon non ti profila e non vende i tuoi dati personali, perché è indipendente, non ha azionisti, investitori o gruppi/circoli/centri a cui rispondere.
  • Puoi liberamente decidere il livello di privacy dei tuoi interventi all'interno della community (un contenuto può essere: pubblico, pubblico ma non pubblicato nella timeline pubblica, visibile solo ai followers, messaggio privato visibile sono ai destinatari menzionati).
  • I tuoi dati personali restano tuoi, puoi decidere in qualsiasi momento di cancellarli o scaricarne una copia.
  • Mastodon rispetta l'anonimato, non ti obbliga ad iscriverti con il tuo nome e cognome o con il tuo numero di telefono, puoi mantenere la tua privacy ed utilizzare qualsiasi nickname
  • Abbiamo solo bisogno di una tua email valida per: la verifica, l'eventuale tuo recupero password, l'invio di eventuali messaggi di servizio da parte dei moderatori. La tua email non viene ceduta o utilizzata per finalità diverse.

senigallia.one è un social non-commerciale

Mastodon è senza pubblicità, senza paywall, senza algoritmi, senza cookies di profilazione. Mastodon non risponde a logiche commerciali, non profila né rivende dati personali, non usa algoritmi per racchiudere gli utenti in una bolla informativa. I social commerciali centralizzati come facebook e twitter offrono i loro servizi "gratis", ma traggono colossali profitti dalla profilazione dei gusti e delle preferenze degli utenti (il prodotto sei tu) e manipolano desideri e comportamenti delle persone (come dimostrato dallo scandalo Cambridge Analytica). Puoi approfondire questo argomento guardando il documentario "The Social Dilemma". Mastodon.uno sopravvive solamente grazie alle donazioni degli utenti: considera la possibilità di dare il tuo contributo! Per coprire i costi di un account attivo bastano pochi centesimi alla settimana!

Siamo una community consigliata dal sito ufficiale di Mastodon Seguiamo rigidi criteri di affidabilità fra cui

  • backup giornalieri
  • più di un responsabile tecnico disponibile in caso di emergenza
  • garanzie tecniche nel mantenere il sito sempre attivo online
  • presenza di una policy che prevede i diritti e i doveri degli utenti per il mantenimento di una community sana
  • moderazione attiva contro contenuti discriminatori e di odio (non è tollerata qualsiasi forma di razzismo, sessismo, omofobia e transfobia)
  • i moderatori sono persone reali disponibili ad ogni chiarimento
  • nessuno scopo di lucro
  • senigallia.one è inoltre una delle poche istanze in cui è attiva la ricerca sul testo, che è disattivata nella maggior parte delle istanze per risparmiare sui costi server.
  • seigallia.one fornisce una ricerca completa per poter facilmente trovare tutti i contenuti in cui si è interagito e recuperare la memoria storica su tutto ciò che si scrive.

Come funziona Mastodon?

Mastodon è una piattaforma software open source, libera, decentralizzata e federata. Mastodon è un'alternativa gratuita alle piattaforme social come Facebook e Twitter. Su Mastodon i messaggi si chiamano "Toot" (è il verso dell'elefantino, simbolo del social) ed in questa istanza è prevista la lunghezza massima standard di 500 caratteri per ogni toot. I toot possono avere quattro livelli di privacy, liberamente selezionabili dall'utente:
  • pubblico (pubblicato in timeline pubblica)
  • pubblico ma non pubblicato nella timeline pubblica
  • visibile solo ai followers
  • messaggio privato visibile sono ai destinatari menzionati
I toot pubblici potrebbero essere indicizzati sui motori di ricerca. Un "Boost" è l'azione con cui si ridiffonde un toot altrui. I messaggi privati, ovvero i toot leggibili soltanto dagli utenti menzionati, sono conservati in chiaro nel database del sistema; quindi, mentre la loro trasmissione avviene sul web con la protezione del protocollo SSL, essi sono leggibili in chiaro da chi abbia accesso al database. La "Timeline locale" presenta i toot dell'istanza Mastodon.uno in ordine cronologico (non ci sono algoritmi che ti suggeriscono contenuti particolari ed ogni toot ha la stessa probabilità di essere visto). La "Timeline federata" presenta i toot provenienti da molte altre istanze, italiane o internazionali, federate con Mastodon.uno. Non sono presenti tutti i toot di tutte le istanze possibili, nessuna istanza federa veramente tutte le altre. Twitter è conosciuto come "Birdsite". Mastodon permette di formare una rete di nodi collegati tra loro (chiamati "istanze") che dialogano fra loro con il protocollo ActivityPub. Mastodon fa parte del network del Fediverso, permettendo ai suoi utenti di sfruttare la struttura federata per interagire anche con utenti su diverse piattaforme aperte che supportano lo stesso protocollo, come PeerTube e Friendica. A differenza dei social commerciali, non c'è un solo server centrale per Mastodon: ogni istanza ha proprie regole, policy di moderazione, lingua e argomenti preferiti di discussione. E' bene che gli utenti si scelgano l'istanza più affine alla propria sensibilità ed interessi. E' sempre possibile migrare il proprio profilo presso un'altra istanza senza perdere contenuti e followers. Mentre ogni singola istanza è caratterizzata da una policy che regolamenta in modo specifico la tipologia di contenuti ammessi, il Fediverso, in quanto formato dall'interazione fra istanze federate, è nel suo complesso pluralista. Per approfondire il funzionamento di Mastodon, è possibile consultare la guida gratuita in italiano mastodon.it.

Quando nasce Mastodon?

Mastodon nasce nel 2016 in Germania per iniziativa del ventiquattrenne Eugen Rochko, per ovviare ai limiti dei social network centralizzati come Twitter ed evitare il rischio che una singola azienda monopolizzi le comunicazioni. L'istanza italiana con un dominio dedicato Mastodon.uno nasce nel 2018 ed entra a far parte della federazione internazionale rappresentando gli utenti di Lingua Italiana. Mastodon.uno è un'istanza italiana autogestita ed autofinanziata in Italia, non è una società e non fa data mining (raccolta, elaborazione e vendita di informazioni personali), siamo presenti su Twitter e su Noblogo.

Perché Mastodon?

Affermare che non si è interessati al diritto alla privacy perché non si ha nulla da nascondere è come dire che non si è interessati alla libertà di parola perché non si ha nulla da dire. (Edward Snowden) Il web è relegato in giardini recintati e gigantesche server farm che sono nelle mani di poche giganti aziende tecnologiche. I nostri post finiscono nelle bacheche di Facebook e Twitter, soggiogati dai termini di servizio che queste aziende americane impongono. Le foto e i video finiscono su piattaforme come Instagram, Snapchat e YouTube, atolli digitali completamente isolati l’uno dall’altro. Tutte queste grandi aziende sono impegnate nell'estrarre valore dai nostri contenuti, nel profilarci nel modo più preciso possibile, in modo tale da influenzare i nostri comportamenti di acquisto, le nostre preferenze politiche, la nostra percezione della realtà, solo in funzione della loro crescita economica. I social commerciali quindi offrono i loro servizi gratuitamente ma traggono profitti dalla profilazione dei gusti e delle preferenze degli utenti. Questo viene chiamato il "Capitalismo della sorveglianza" e la sua accettazione da parte del pubblico attraverso l'argomentazione "non ho nulla da nascondere" è stata ben descritta nel documentario "Nothing To Hide". Nel documentario"The Social Dilemma" viene ben illustrato come l'utilizzo improprio e incontrollato di questi dati porti a un aumento della dipendenza dai social, manipolazione psicologica, formazione di una filter bubble, l'alimentazione della disinformazione. Questa enorme mole di dati può essere messa a disposizione anche di governi (come è accaduto con lo scandalo di Cambridge Analytica) per orientare facilmente opinioni e comportamenti. Mastodon è una alternativa open source e free alle piattaforme social come facebook e twitter, una federazione di istanze aperta e decentralizzata chiamata Fediverso. Il Fediverso è la comunità delle community, privo di pubblicità e di scopi di lucro, privo di algoritmi di profilazione e modifica comportamentale. Tutte le istanze del Fediverso comunicano fra di loro, senza alcun scopo di lucro e non si appropriano dei dati della nostra vita social, non registrano e non analizzano le nostre relazioni e le nostre comunicazioni. Gli utenti non dipendono da un decisore unico e non sono concentrati e vincolati in una sola proprietà, ma possono essere liberi di seguire utenti su altri server ed eventualmente essere liberi di migrare verso altre istanze, senza per questo perdere i propri contatti e i contenuti inseriti.

Vuoi saperne di più?

Consulta la policy di questa istanza, che contiene i diritti e i doveri dei partecipanti alla community e le regole di moderazione. Se hai bisogno di aiuto, leggi la guida in italiano di mastodon.it Chiedi aiuto all'amministratore o ai moderatori Consulta il portale italiano https://mastodon.it ed il sito ufficiale di Mastodon: https://joinmastodon.org/
Short: Mastodon è un social network non commerciale, federato e decentralizzato. Senigallia One è una istanza italiana offerta e gestita dal quotidiano online Vivere Senigallia.

About

A community for NSFW artists. No kink left behind, within the bounds of a strongly enforced moderation policy against hateful or illegal content.

Membership Applications

This server is focused on hosting NSFW artists. To join please indicate that you are an artist, ideally with a link to some of your work (SFW/NSFW/any medium). This is just to verify that you are a creator.

If you want to follow the artists here you can follow from any of the other instances you can find here: https://joinmastodon.org/servers and then browse our members here: https://eggplant.social/directory

Description: IDDQD: Instance For /vr/, /tg/, /g/, etc.

Sobre o fim.social

O fim.social é uma instância do Mastodon brasileira e não temática. Nosso objetivo é fornecer mais uma casa para atender a crescente demanda de usuários brasileiros do Mastodon.

Essa é uma instância moderada. Somos uma comunidade feminista, antirracista, anticolonialista, pró-ciência, anti-fascista e inclusiva a pessoas trans e não-binárias.

Para mantermos esse espaço sadio e seguro, todos os usuários do fim.social têm o compromisso de seguir nosso código de conduta.

Nosso time de moderadores estará sempre atento, e, em qualquer caso de violação das regras de nosso código de conduta, os usuários poderão ser silenciados, suspensos e até banidos dependendo da severidade da violação.

Dicas

Para começar bem:

  • Escolha um avatar bacana
  • Escreva algo na bio do seu perfil
  • Ative a autenticação de dois fatores
  • Faça uma publicação se apresentando :)
  • Fixe a publicação no seu perfil (clique na publicação, ... , fixar)

Sobre descrição de imagens para acessibilidade

  • Coloque descrição nas imagens e mídias que subir

Instâncias Brasileiras

Recomendamos estas instâncias (em ordem alfabética):

  • bantu.social
  • bemtevi.social
  • bolha.us
  • colorid.es
  • conversafiada.net
  • cuscuz.in
  • komuna.digital
  • mastodon.com.br
  • masto.donte.com.br
  • piupiupiu.com.br
  • ursal.zone
  • vira-lata.org

Nossos times

No momento o fim.social é mantido exclusivamente pelo @marcus.

Nossa instância

O fim.social é hopedado pela Digital Ocean com modestos recursos:

  • 1 droplet com 2 vCPUs e 4GB de RAM
  • Banco de dados gerenciado com 2GB de RAM e 25GB de disco
  • Armazenamento de objetos (DO Spaces)

Tudo junto, isso gera um custo mensal de aproximadamente US$ 60.

Conteúdo e Leis

Responsabilidade civil

O conteúdo postado em nossa instância é de inteira responsabilidade do USUÁRIO, não podendo os mantenedores da PLATAFORMA serem RESPONSABILIZADOS por quaisquer fatos decorrentes da postagem desse conteúdo, de acordo com o art. 19 da Lei nº 12.965, de 2014.

Em resumo, a responsabilidade por seus posts, ou posts das contas que você administra é sua, e somente sua.

Nossa responsabilidade se limita a remover conteúdo quando solicitado e colaborar com as autoridades.

Vamos dar todo o apoio a autoridades para acessar o conteúdo especificado, remover e identificar usuários desde que solicitado por vias legais através de uma ordem judicial.

Código de Conduta

Desrespeito às leis

Atitudes ou ações contrárias as leis brasileiras não serão permitidas nesta instância.

Comportamentos inadmissíveis em nossa instância

Contas que engajarem nos seguintes padrões de comportamento serão suspensas ou banidas sem recurso.

Publicação de conteúdo ilegal, ou ainda sem definição legal concreta, como:

  • Pornografia infantil.
  • Conteúdo que fetichiza menores de idade (i.e. lolicon, shotacon).

Publicação de conteúdos que incentivem práticas nocivas:

  • Maus-tratos ou crueldade contra animais.
  • Discurso que romantiza e/ou incentiva práticas nocivas ao bem-estar físico ou mental como distúrbios alimentares, automutilação (cutting) e suicídio.

Publicação de material protegido

  • Publicação, reprodução ou referências para material protegido como áudio, vídeo, imagens ou software. (pirataria)

Discurso de ódio e/ou inflamatório, como:

  • Comportamentos e discursos racistas, sexistas, misóginos, homofóbicos, transfóbicos, capacitistas, xenofóbicos, islamofóbicos, gordofóbicos. Ameaças de violência ou linguagem violenta direcionada a outras pessoas.
  • Apologia a governos totalitários.
  • Xenofobia e/ou nacionalismo extremista.
  • Desinformação intencional..

Em especial nestes tempos tenebrosos, para ficar ainda mais claro:

  • Questionar o processo eleitoral Brasileiro.
  • Questionar a segurança das urnas eletrônicas.
  • Questionar a legitimidade do TSE ou STF e da Justiça como um todo.
  • Disseminar fakenews sobre as eleições Brasileiras.
  • Perdir golpe militar no Brasil.
  • Fazer apologia ao nazismo ou fascismo.

Esse tipo de discurso é infracão grave com supensão direta e imediata.

Discurso anti-ciência e pseudociência como:

  • Apologia a pseudociência.
  • Apologia ao terraplanismo.
  • Apologia ao uso de remédios ineficazes para tratar doenças como a COVID.
  • Qualquer outro tipo de discurso anti-ciência ou pesudociência Esse tipo de discurso é infracão grave com supensão direta e imediata.

Ameaça de publicação ou publicação de conteúdo privado, como:

  • Informações pessoais identificáveis (prática conhecida como "doxing").
  • Conversas privadas, como mensagens privadas ou diretas, sem o consentimento da outra parte, em especial com o objetivo de vingança e ou humilhação pública.

Atitudes invasivas e/ou intimidadoras, como:

  • Fazer comentários ou perguntas invasivos (tais como "qual é o seu nome de registro?" ou insistir em saber a localização de determinada pessoa).
  • Insistir em continuar uma conversa após a outra parte expressamente pedir para que ela se encerre (assédio).
  • Atenção sexual indesejada. Isso inclui piadas ou comentários sexuais; e avanços sexuais indesejados.
  • Intimidação deliberada, stalking.

Falsidade ideológica, como:

  • Criar contas para se passar por celebridades ou marcas. Contas paródia ou contas de fã precisam estar explicitamente sinalizadas.

Comportamentos desencorajados

Os comportamentos a seguir são desencorajados. A reincidência, após advertência, também ocasionará em suspensão.

  • Flood (postar repetidamente ou pequenas mensagens sem intervalo) nas timelines públicas (local e federada).
  • Spam (mensagens indesejadas ou não requisitadas).
  • Venda ou promoção de produtos ou cursos na timeline.

Política de aviso de conteúdo

O uso de aviso de conteúdo é obrigatório em postagens que:

  • Mencionam assuntos traumáticos (por exemplo: estupro, violência). Contenham enredo de séries, jogos e filmes (por exemplo: 'Spoilers de Star Wars Andor S01E01').
  • Contenham nudez, conteúdo sexual e imagens de violência (mesmo que em representações artísticas).
  • Descrições explícitas de sexo ou conteúdo sexual em postagens públicas.
  • Vídeos com movimentos rápidos e luzes intermitentes.

Outras Informações

Como reportar uma violação do código de conduta

O Mastodon possui ferramentas internas de denúncia. Qualquer post ou perfil que você acredite que esteja em violação dessas regras pode ser denunciado utilizando a ferramenta interna do Mastodon e ele será enviado aos moderadores.

Caso a sua denúncia seja relativa a um dos moderadores, você pode reportar a violação através de mensagem direta à um dos outros moderadores.

Você pode fazer uma denúncia mesmo que a sua situação não seja diretamente coberta por essas regras, caso a situação lhe cause desconforto. A moderação irá avaliar cada situação individualmente.

Respondemos de maneira privada à todas as denúncias que recebemos, fazendo um esforço para que a primeira resposta seja dada nas primeiras 24 horas.

Entenda os níveis de privacidade

No Mastodon cada status pode ser postado em quatro diferentes configurações de audiência. É importante ter isso em mente porque certas regras só se aplicam a algumas configurações e não a outras:

  • PÚBLICA: A publicação aparece no feed dos seus seguidores, na página pública do seu perfil, na busca por hashtags, no feed local (compartilhado pelos demais membros da instância) e no feed federado (compartilhado por todas as instâncias federadas).
  • NÃO LISTADA: A publicação aparece no feed dos seus seguidores e na página pública do seu perfil. Porém, não é listada (não aparece) em buscas por hashtags, nem no feed local, nem no feed federado.
  • SOMENTE SEGUIDORES: A publicação aparece apenas no feed dos seus seguidores. Porém, não aparece na página pública do seu perfil, nem em buscas por hashtags, nem no feed local, nem no feed federado.
  • MENSAGEM DIRETA: A publicação aparece apenas no feed das pessoas marcadas por você.

ATENÇÃO: Mensagens diretas não devem ser confundidas com mensagens privadas, pois o Mastodon não é uma ferramenta projetada para a troca segura de mensagens criptografadas de ponta a ponta.

Os moderadores da instância podem acessar todas as mensagens publicadas a qualquer momento e o farão em casos de denúncias. Leia a nossa política sobre mensagens diretas mais adiante.

Sobre mensagens diretas

Mensagens diretas não são mensagens privadas. O Mastodon não é uma ferramenta projetada para a troca segura de mensagens criptografadas de ponta a ponta. Tenha em mente que os moderadores podem acessar a qualquer momento todas as mensagens publicadas na instância, inclusive as mensagens com audiência reduzida (mensagens diretas), e o farão sempre que houver alguma denúncia.

Os moderadores da fim.social pactuam dois compromissos com a comunidade em relação às mensagens com audiência reduzida (mensagens diretas):

Os moderadores da fim.social acessarão o conteúdo de mensagens diretas sempre que e exclusivamente nos casos em que algum dos usuários citados em uma mensagem direta denuncie a publicação ou seu autor.

Os moderadores da fim.social não acessarão o conteúdo de mensagens diretas em nenhum outro caso, sob pena desta ação ser analisada pelos demais moderadores podendo ser punidos com suspensão ou até banimento por quebra de confiança.

Não recomendamos que você utilize o Mastodon para transmitir informações sensíveis ou sigilosas, esse não é um espaço para isso.

Caso você tenha a necessidade de trocar mensagens com privacidade e segurança, recomendamos o uso de ferramentas e de protocolos abertos que tenham sido desenvolvidas com software livre e que sigam o estado da arte dos protocolos criptográficos públicos. Tais como o mensageiro instantâneo Signal ou o utilitário de criptografia OpenPGP.

Agradecimentos

Instâncias amigas

Agradecemos aos times e comunidades das instâncias

  • ursal.zone, por ser um modelo para todos nós.
  • bolha.us, por compartilhar suas regras e descrições, de onde copiamos 99% das nossas.
Short: Instância do Mastodon brasileira e não temática, quer dizer, aqui (quase) todo assunto é bem vindo.

Description:
Doneren?

Doneren kan via:

  • Patreon

Opschortingsbeleid

We schorten periodiek accounts op die voldoen aan één of meer van de volgende criteria:

  • Duidelijke spam account
  • Inactieve account (geen posts, een maand of langer niet ingelogd)
  • Account die een andere taal dan Nederlands of Engels gebruikt in het profiel of posts

Bij twijfel beslissen admins onderling alvorens tot opschorting over te gaan.

Description:
Summary

A open community-led social network, funded, administered and hosted by a global community of critical care clinicians.

You can support us here: https://opencollective.com/critcare. Everyone’s circumstances are different so please only contribute if you feel comfortable doing so.

Principles

This server is owned and run by a community of users. Admins are volunteers from the community, and will earn and maintain trust by using their powers cautiously and sparingly.

The lifespan of this venture will be, as with literally everything else, finite. It may begin to decline in 6 months, or 10 years, but when it is superseded, we’ll move forwards, and will remember it fondly.

Constitution

Every decision is made by majority vote among the administrators. Administrators are appointed by approval by the existing admins.

Staff

  • Tom Williams (server) @Watergypsy
  • Mathieu Desgroseilliers (finances) @matdesgro
  • Kenny Baillie (server) @kennethbaillie
  • Aoife Abbe (admin) @Whistlingdixie4
  • Charlotte Summers (admin) @Charlotte_Summers
  • Jack Iwashyna (admin) @iwashyna
  • Lars Mølgaard Saxhaug @load_dependent
  • redneeraj @neerajsingh
  • Rob Mac Sweeney (admin) @critcarereviews
  • Rosie Baruah (admin) @RosieICM
  • Segun Olusanya (admin) @Iceman_ex

Image

The image on the front page is Rosie Baruah’s. Contact her for related requests: @RosieICM

Guidance

Article from 1998 on “The art of hosting online conversations”

How to copy your follows from twitter: https://pruvisto.org/debirdify/

How to cross-post from/to other platforms: https://crossposter.masto.donte.com.br/
Short: An open community-led social network, funded and administered by a global community of critical care clinicians. opencollective.com/critcare

[{'id': '1', 'text': 'By being here, you agree to follow the Julia Language Code of Coduct: https://julialang.org/community/standards/'}, {'id': '2', 'text': 'Be respectful and inclusive'}, {'id': '3', 'text': 'Please do not use overtly sexual language or imagery.'}, {'id': '4', 'text': 'Do not attack anyone based on any aspect of personal identity, including gender, sexuality, politics, religion, ethnicity, race, age, or ability.'}, {'id': '5', 'text': "Keep in mind that what you write or say in public forums is read or heard by many people who don't know you personally, so please refrain from making prejudiced or sexual jokes and comments – even ones that you might consider acceptable in private."}, {'id': '6', 'text': 'Ask yourself if a comment or statement might make someone feel unwelcomed or like an outsider.'}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'In particular, do not sexualize the term "Julia" or any other aspects of the project. While "Julia" is a female name in many parts of the world, the programming language is not a person and does not have a gender.

'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'All participants in the Julia community are expected to respect copyright laws and ethical attribution standards. This applies to both code and written materials, such as documentation or blog posts.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'Materials that violate the law, are plagiaristic, or ethically dubious in some way will be removed from officially-maintained lists of resources.

'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'If you believe one of these standards has been violated, you can either file an issue on an appropriate repository or confidentially contact the Julia Stewards at stewards@julialang.org. Keep in mind that most mistakes are due to ignorance rather than malice.

'}, {'id': '11', 'text': 'Be concise. Constructive criticism and suggestions are welcome, but high-traffic forums do not generally have the bandwidth for extensive discourse. Consider writing a blog post if you feel that you have enough to say on a particular subject.

'}, {'id': '12', 'text': 'We welcome the participation of researchers of all kinds in the Julia community. However, please remember that open source development is a social process and that the participants on the other side of any interaction are (obviously) humans.'}, {'id': '13', 'text': 'If you are doing research on the community or its processes, you are likely performing Human Subjects Research (HSR) and are expected to abide by the highest standards of ethics and professional practice. Meeting this expectation is your responsibility.'}, {'id': '14', 'text': 'We consider engaging in unethical research (human subject or otherwise) to be a cause for bans or other sanctions from the community.'}, {'id': '15', 'text': 'The Julia community is built on a foundation of reciprocity and collaboration. Be aware that most community members contribute on a voluntary basis, so ideas and bug reports are ok, but demands are not.'}, {'id': '16', 'text': 'If you have a conflict or concern that requires resolution, please contact the Julia Community Stewards'}]
cleaned_rules:
['By being here, you agree to follow the Julia Language Code of Coduct: https://julialang.org/community/standards/', 'Be respectful and inclusive', 'Please do not use overtly sexual language or imagery.', 'Do not attack anyone based on any aspect of personal identity, including gender, sexuality, politics, religion, ethnicity, race, age, or ability.', "Keep in mind that what you write or say in public forums is read or heard by many people who don't know you personally, so please refrain from making prejudiced or sexual jokes and comments – even ones that you might consider acceptable in private.", 'Ask yourself if a comment or statement might make someone feel unwelcomed or like an outsider.', 'In particular, do not sexualize the term "Julia" or any other aspects of the project. While "Julia" is a female name in many parts of the world, the programming language is not a person and does not have a gender.

', 'All participants in the Julia community are expected to respect copyright laws and ethical attribution standards. This applies to both code and written materials, such as documentation or blog posts.', 'Materials that violate the law, are plagiaristic, or ethically dubious in some way will be removed from officially-maintained lists of resources.

', 'If you believe one of these standards has been violated, you can either file an issue on an appropriate repository or confidentially contact the Julia Stewards at stewards@julialang.org. Keep in mind that most mistakes are due to ignorance rather than malice.

', 'Be concise. Constructive criticism and suggestions are welcome, but high-traffic forums do not generally have the bandwidth for extensive discourse. Consider writing a blog post if you feel that you have enough to say on a particular subject.

', 'We welcome the participation of researchers of all kinds in the Julia community. However, please remember that open source development is a social process and that the participants on the other side of any interaction are (obviously) humans.', 'If you are doing research on the community or its processes, you are likely performing Human Subjects Research (HSR) and are expected to abide by the highest standards of ethics and professional practice. Meeting this expectation is your responsibility.', 'We consider engaging in unethical research (human subject or otherwise) to be a cause for bans or other sanctions from the community.', 'The Julia community is built on a foundation of reciprocity and collaboration. Be aware that most community members contribute on a voluntary basis, so ideas and bug reports are ok, but demands are not.', 'If you have a conflict or concern that requires resolution, please contact the Julia Community Stewards']

Description:
本站须知

1. 本站随时有跑路、下线、炸站风险，请注意定期备份关注列表及嘟文。

2. 本站用户所创造的内容全部属于用户本人，用户对其内容绝对的拥有和处置权。

3. 本站尽力打造畅所欲言的环境，但如果您有骚扰他人、人身攻击的行为，或者发表纳粹、仇恨言论及真人儿童色情相关内容，本站将酌情进行警告和封禁。

4. 请注意：注册后两周内，若您未曾使用您的账号，即：未曾进行修改昵称、修改头像、发表嘟文等任何一项操作，致使您的账号在两周后依然保持无头像、无嘟文、无昵称修改的状态，那么您的账号将被删除。您若想重新注册需要更换用户名。

5. 本站将每日备份数据并上传至Scaleway，所有存档将保留7日。因此，若您删除了自己的账号，您的相关数据仍将保留7日，请知悉。

6. 本站管理员可获得的信息包括并仅限于您的邮箱和登录IP，远少于绝大多数社交平台。但为保护您的隐私，您可以考虑使用VPN登录，并避免使用可能暴露您隐私的邮箱，如QQ邮箱，或以手机号注册的邮箱等。

7. 和推特、微博一样，Mastodon的私信并未加密，管理员可以通过服务器调取信息。本站管理员承诺未经允许不主动调阅任何用户的私信，但请以和微博、推特私信一样的谨慎处理Mastodon私信，不要在其中暴露您的敏感信息，如详细地址、银行卡账号、密码等。

使用指南

具体使用方法可参见：https://docs.joinmastodon.org/zh-cn/

本站发送公开嘟文的机器人镜像号列表

小众软件 @appinn@pullopen.xyz
剧院资讯 @theater@pullopen.xyz
三联生活周刊 @lifeweek@pullopen.xyz
游研社 @yystv@pullopen.xyz
观止·每日一文 @guanzhi@pullopen.xyz
上海书评 @shuping@pullopen.xyz
搜狐新闻 @souhunews@pullopen.xyz
女权剪报 @feminism@pullopen.xyz
人物 @renwu@pullopen.xyz
时光网Mtime @Mtime@pullopen.xyz
端傳媒 The Initium Media @initium@pullopen.xyz

如有不适，请屏蔽或隐藏。
Short: 这里是在宇宙中漂流的蓝盒子，Speak friend and enter！

Description:
Nicuverse is affiliated to 99Nicu, an independent and international Internet community for neonatal staff.

99nicu provides a platform for sharing expertise and experience regardless of geographical boundaries and time zones.

Read more at: https://99nicu.org/nicuverse-faqs/

Description:
Brands Town (normally referred to as brands.town, or brands dot town), is a Mastodon-based platform dedicated entirely to brand accounts. Many of these brands are organizations you may have never heard of, whilst some of them may seem all-too-familiar. The nature of this platform is to give companies a fresh start on an exciting new decentralized ecosystem, where there's a space for everyone.

Brands Town is where a brand can be a brand.
Short: Brands Town is the first ever Mastodon Instance dedicated solely to corporate brand promotion.

Description:
Server rules

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

-Excessive advertising
-Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources -Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions -Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
-Racism or advocation of racism
-Sexism or advocation of sexism -Casteism or advocation of casteism -Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
-Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
-Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health -The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
-Sexual depictions of children -Content illegal in Sweden
-Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
-Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
-Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
-Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment. These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Short: Svensk version av Mastodon.

Description:
genart.social

Welcome to genart.social, a home on the Fediverse for generative artists. We are an inclusive community which values diversity and encourages creative exploration. All artists are welcome, regardless of their background or experience level. Our community is LGBTQIA+ friendly and supports all forms of generative expression, including (but not limited to) algorithmic art, AI art, crypto art, glitch art; art or music made with any kind of dynamic system. Our server is located in Germany, and we welcome all languages.

We value accessibility. Use of captions for all posted media is strongly encouraged.

Let's collaborate to make the Fediverse a more visually interesting place!

Banner art by @jesshewitt.

Please note that registration is currently by invitation only.

🏳️‍⚧️ 🏳️‍🌈 ✊🏿

About Crypto Art

We kindly request members to keep posts about crypto art low-key and consider adding the #nft tag and content warning when posting about them. Content warnings are not intended to penalize content, they are part of our culture and considered best practice. They are widely used when posting sensitive content, such as disturbing imagery, mentions of violence, spoilers, politics, nudity, or pictures of food.
Short:
genart.social is a home on the fediverse for artists working in the #generative, #AI, and #glitch spaces.

Registration is currently invite-only.
topic: genart.social - A Home For Generative Artists

Description:
• Serveur mis en place et dont les frais sont pris en charge par www.caporalstrategique.fr dans un premier temps.
  • Nous restons attaché à la liberté d'expression tel qu'il est en place dans le cadre européen et français. Nous sommes tout autant attaché à l'idée que vous dites parfois n'importe quoi et que les faits existent.

Description:
Welcome all Friends of DeSoto!

This is a Star Trek Podcast Community for people a little bit embarrassed to be part of a Star Trek Podcast Community!

Captain DeSoto and the crew of the U.S.S Hood are happy to ferry you and all fans of Star Trek, The Greatest Generation, and Greatest Trek on your voyages through the Fediverse.


Want to add a little fuel to the warp core?
Short: Greatest Trek Podcast Fans! This is a Star Trek Podcast Community for people a little embarrassed to be part of a Star Trek Podcast Community. A home for fans of Greatest Gen & Greatest Trek.

Description:
episcodon.net is a Mastodon server for individuals and groups associated with The Episcopal Church. episcodon.net is not officially affiliated with or endorsed by The Episcopal Church.

episcodon.net is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant and is listed on the Mastodon Servers page.

Membership on this server is free. However, the owner incurs monthly overhead costs to keep the server up and running. Please consider making a one-time or recurring donation using Patreon.

Our core values as Episcopalians are expressed in the Baptismal Covenant. We encourage all server members to exemplify these values—especially the promise to "strive for justice and peace among all people, and respect the dignity of every human being"—as they interact with others.

Remember that our Anglican heritage began as a via media (middle road) between Catholicism and Protestantism. Episcopalians today hold diverse positions on religious, political, social, and other issues. We ask server members to give each other the grace to hold different beliefs, and to discuss their differences civilly.

Our server rules are intended to make episcodon.net a safe and enjoyable place for all members. Hate speech of any kind is prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, expressions of support for the following:

  • ableism and disablism
  • ageism
  • antisemitism and Islamophobia
  • casteism
  • colonialism and imperialism
  • homophobia and transphobia (including targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy")
  • Nazism and other forms of fascism
  • sexism and misogyny
  • racism and colorism
  • xenophobia

If you encounter content that violates server rules, please report it. The server admins will review it as soon as possible. Content that violates server rules will be removed at the discretion of the server admins. Users who violate server rules will be suspended at the discretion of the server admins.

Please be aware that Mastodon is free and open-source software (FOSS), so anyone can start a Mastodon instance. Also, Mastodon is only one part of the larger fediverse. Our server becomes automatically federated with any other server with which our users interact. Some of those servers may contain content that is objectionable to you (and probably the majority of our users). If you encounter such servers in your Federated timeline, please report them. The admins will investigate them and, if necessary, block them. You can find a list of blocked servers at the bottom of our About page.

Server recommendations

  1. Be kind. Love your neighbor as yourself.
  2. Complete your user profile. Other users are more likely to follow you if you add your name, a bio, a header image, and an avatar image. If you prefer to remain anonymous, that’s fine.
  3. Introduce yourself with an initial post. Indicate your interests with hashtags.
  4. Add descriptive text to all images, videos, and audio files you attach to posts. People who use screen readers need descriptive text to interpret content they cannot see.
  5. Use the appropriate level of privacy for your posts. Do you want a post to be visible to everyone, only to people who follow you, or to the specific people mentioned in the post?
  6. Make good use of content warnings. Ask yourself, “Is what I’m posting likely to be a trauma trigger for some readers?” If the answer is yes, add a content warning to your post.
  7. Keep in mind that text-based communication is limited. The visual and auditory clues present in face-to-face communication are missing. If a post hits you the wrong way, gently ask the author for clarification.
  8. If you have an issue with someone else’s post, try to discuss your concern with that person privately. If you are unable to resolve the issue, file a report.
  9. Don’t use the server rules to censor users who hold different positions from your own. Instead, be curious and ask open questions. However, if the user is clearly violating server rules, file a report.
  10. Use camel case in hastags. For example, type #TheEpiscopalChurch rather than #theepiscopalchurch. Camel case is easier to read and is a necessity for people who use screen readers. Be aware that Mastodon may try to lowercase your hashtag.
Short: a Mastodon instance for Episcopalians

Description:
This is a kink-friendly, 🏳️‍🌈-welcoming community. As long as everyone abides by common decency, you get to be whoever and whatever you want to be here.

Tips and Tricks

  • Follow some accounts, whether on this server, or accounts on other Mastodon sites, so that you get content into your timeline.
  • Images are limited to 10 MB, and videos are limited to 40 MB. GIFs are normally converted to a looping video to save bandwidth (the same way it's done on Tumblr and Twitter).
  • Opt-in to let others find your account by checking "Suggest account to others" in your profile.
  • Content warnings are strongly encouraged for any explicit content that Rule 2 allows (e.g., genitals). Some of the content on this site gets federated to other Mastodon servers that have more restrictive rules requiring content warnings. Content warnings are not strictly enforced on this server; but if you post without one, followers here or on other servers will likely flag them for moderation. We're trying to maintain a balance between allowing free expression and federating with other servers that may be more vanilla or have varied norms.

Finding People

When you have an account on this server or any Mastodon server that federates, you can follow and interact with users on other Mastodon servers, without needing to create an account on each one. Here are some places to start discovering content and people:

  • Our opt-in directory - choose "From hypno.social only"
  • Our local timeline - all public posts made by accounts on this server
  • Federated timeline - public posts from people followed by any user on Hypno Social, even accounts on other servers
  • rubber.social
  • mastodon.hypnoguys.com
  • woof.group
  • mastodon.lol
  • mastodon.triggerphra.se

Moderation

We may moderate proactively or in response to reports to enforce server rules. If you are interested in helping with this effort, message @deeplyasleep.

Use of this platform is governed by the server rules and the Privacy Policy.
Short: A kink-friendly, 🏳️‍🌈-welcoming community.

Description:
ni.hil.ist is a server run by individuals who are friendly to a nihilistic perspective. This Mastodon server is for anarchists, environmentalists, anti-racists, anti-capitalists, anti-authoritarians, children of ressentiment, aunties, queers, hackers, saboteurs, nihilists, and various other friendly people.

Our onion address is http://nihilistidbo35bixvusyy3lsdszrrhtjpshhz277omdom6n45so5vad.onion
Hopefully more anonymizing services will be available soon.

This server blocks several domains that are havens for abuse, discrimination, spam, are corporate run, or are otherwise undesirable.
Short: ni.hil.ist is a server run by individuals who are friendly to a nihilistic worldview.

Description:
A brief welcome

A few of us started this server looking for a small place to land together in the 'fediverse' – hopefully a safer place. We're front-end web makers who value humans over technology, and embrace diversity on an open, accessible, progressively-enhanced web.

We were not expecting so much interest! It's exciting! But we're still new to this, not set up to grow large or fast. This isn't a corporate venue, it's our virtual living room – and we have a small apartment.

It's hard turning people away, but we think it's important not to take on more than we can care for, in our spare time. So our registrations are currently paused, with a few exceptions. Please bear with us – the goal is not to be exclusive, but to be sustainable in our growth.

More info on who we are, invite policies, and supporting the server over at about.front-end.social »

💖 @mods

Our code of conduct

Front-end.social is a community built on respect and inclusivity. As a member of front-end.social, you agree to uphold an environment of consideration for all members, especially those from traditionally minoritized communities.

If you think you can resolve a problem you’re having with someone’s behavior without getting admins involved, we encourage you to. Early interventions from someone’s friends and acquaintances are way more likely to actually fix someone’s bad behavior than letting it fester until we need to step in. Please feel free to report behavior to admins if you think it’s something you can’t deal with.

Admins reserve the right to take whatever action deemed necessary if these guidelines are violated, including but not limited to: warnings, temporary suspension, and site bans. Any language or action that expresses, reinforces, upholds or sympathizes with any form of systemic social domination is considered oppressive and is grounds for removal at any level deemed appropriate by the admins. All potential violations are manually reviewed by a human being; we do not use any automated systems to take disciplinary action, although we may use automated tooling to help detect certain violations.

Membership & Invitation Expectations

While we may be the first front-end focused Mastodon instance, it is not our goal to be the one de-facto instance. We want our community to remain a reasonable size to promote a healthy culture. We encourage others to build other similar communities!

Front-end.social is semi-open. We are still actively working through what this looks like. We are working on our application process, which will hopefully include a more tailored application form than the default Mastodon one. Thanks for bearing with us.

Please help us make this instance inviting and inclusive. If you are interested in front-end web development (or don’t mind hanging with those who do) and you support our values, you're welcome here!

Recommended Post Etiquette

Since this is a semi-open instance, we have some guidelines and recommendations for joining the community outlined below. Please keep in mind that these guidelines are designed to encourage positive and supportive interactions within front-end.social, not to police behavior.

Community members are encouraged to share and recommend these best practices to their fellow community members, especially when someone joins on your invite.

🗣 Introduce yourself!

Once you've had some time to get the lay of the land, it's a great idea to write a quick #introduction (and include that hashtag so others can find it).

❤️ Before you promote, participate!

It's super cool to share the stuff you're working on, invite people to events, ask for help, share work opportunities/gigs, etc. But please try not to make these your first or only posts! Join in the conversation, say hello, make an introduction above, even share *other* people's stuff. All of these things will help you build connections and earn trust. Besides, people are way more likely to pay attention to (and boost/click/share) the stuff you share if they recognize you!

In general, promoting stuff is good. It's how we learn what's going on, and help each other. If you're active in the community and sharing something you think others might like, you don't have to worry. Drive-by promotion doesn't help the community, so please try to avoid it.

🚨 Please consider using "content warnings."

We ask that you put the following topics behind a content warning (CW) (photos can be marked with the eye symbol - after uploading, before posting):

  • graphic violence or gore
  • flashing video/gifs
  • spoilers

We encourage you to toot about your lived experience freely, without content warning. We don't support and will not tolerate the silencing of underrepresented and minoritized people sharing their truths – or pointing out issues in the industry and platform. That said, if you are posting on triggering topics, we encourage you to consider the content warning feature.

When in doubt, CW. Our goal is to create a space where we are not overwhelmed by negative posts or bombarded by the 24 hour news cycle. Twitter's algorithm encouraged doom scrolling. We don't want to replicate that here.

CW are also often used as courtesy to help followers pre-screen sensitive or particularly noisy topics. Examples of this might include meta-discussion about Mastodon itself (commonly tagged 'fedi meta') or mental health (tag 'mh'). This sort of use is not required on our instance, but it a norm of Mastodon etiquette at large.

🌄 Image captions

Please add descriptive image captions to any images you post. We have added custom CSS to the site to highlight where descriptions are added, and their presence or absence on images.

Behavior & Content

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in a ban from front-end.social:

  • Unapproved bots (for approval, please contact the admins)
  • Plagiarism
  • Pornography and sexually explicit content without a content warning
  • Gore and graphic violence not hidden by a content warning
  • Intentional misinformation

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in a ban from front-end.social:

  • Promoting the oppression of any group based on gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or class
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of fascism, radical nationalism, or xenophobia
  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  • Content that is illegal in nations where our members are active and content that facilitates illegal activity

Any conduct intended to stalk, harass, or intimidate other people, or to impede other people from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass others, or to incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions is forbidden and subject to punishment up to and including a ban from front-end.social.

This can include, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a person that has specifically requested for said engagement to cease may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission.
  • Inciting people to engage another person in continued interaction or discussion after a person has requested for said engagement to cease and desist may be considered harassment.
  • Posting and/or disseminating a person's posts ("toots"), including screen captures or any other content without express permission.
  • Intentionally posting or disseminating libel, slander, or other disinformation.

This Code of Conduct applies both to content on front-end.social and to public spaces when an individual is representing front-end.social or its community.

Reports of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be made by using the report button. All reports will be reviewed and dealt with as soon as possible. Admins are obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.

The admins reserve the right to revoke any user's content on or access to front-end.social, at any time, for any reason.

Our current moderators are: @mia, @estelle, @keithjgrant, @kitt, and @grigs. You can reach us through the @mods account.

No creepy crawlies (robot.txt set to disallow). No secret crypto mining operations.

A special note about tech flame-wars

You are welcome to your own opinions regarding technology, the web, code formatting, and the pronunciation of “gif” but we ask that if you choose to express these opinions, you do so in a respectful way.

Furthermore—and perhaps even more importantly—strive to extend the benefit of the doubt to others as they express their opinions. Rather than assuming a 200-character post encompasses the full extent of a complicated issue, ask clarifying questions before launching a rebuttal—or simply keep scrolling. Don’t make the admins “choose a side” because a disagreement gets out of hand.
Short: Front-end web makers who value humans over technology & embrace diversity on an accessible web. We hope to stay small & grow slowly. Mascots by @stephaniewalter. More at https://about.front-end.social

Description:
Mastodon es una red social libre, federada y descentralizada que, junto con otros muchos productos, forma parte del fediverso. Cada usuario elige en qué servidor registrarse, bajo qué reglas, y cómo interactúa con los demás miembros. Algunos, incluso, ejecutan sus propios servidores, y es exactamente lo que hemos hecho nosotros. Esta instancia es administrada por los miembros de la Asociación Comunidad Hispanohablante de NVDA, también conocida como Comunidad de NVDA en español. Nuestro objetivo principal consiste en promover la utilización del lector de pantalla libre y de código abierto NVDA entre personas ciegas de habla hispana. A raíz de los acontecimientos sucedidos en Twitter a partir de octubre de 2022, hemos decidido poner en marcha esta instancia, de propósito general, y fomentar el uso del fediverso entre nuestros usuarios.

Nota: si lo consideras adecuado, puedes copiar el contenido de los dos siguientes desplegables y usarlo en tu instancia, siempre que cites la fuente de procedencia.

Recomendaciones para nuevos usuarios

 Seguramente te han dicho que Mastodon es una alternativa a Twitter, y eso te hace pensar que son muy parecidos. Si bien es cierto que tienen sus similitudes, también hay notables diferencias que no se pueden pasar por alto. Aquí te dejamos algunos consejos para empezar:
  • Los nombres de usuario son como en Twitter, pero sólo si mencionas a personas de tu instancia (por ejemplo, @jmdaweb). De lo contrario, hay que añadir el dominio al que pertenecen cuando quieras mencionarlos. Por ejemplo, @jmdaweb@comunidad.nvda.es.
  • El buscador está muy limitado, no esperes encontrar resultados de todo el fediverso con él. Sólo aparecerán publicaciones de usuarios que hayan consentido ser indexados. Puedes optar a que se indexen tus publicaciones en las opciones de privacidad de tu cuenta. Podrás usar el buscador con total seguridad para escribir nombres de usuario o explorar una publicación cuya URL tienes. Existen instancias que no disponen del software Elastic Search, y allí las búsquedas están mucho más restringidas.
  • Un Me gusta es un reconocimiento al usuario que ha escrito una publicación. Lo verá porque le llegará una notificación, y el toot se guardará en tus favoritos, pero no se difundirá. Si quieres difundir una publicación, usa siempre el botón Retootear, rebloguear, Boostear, Impulsar, o como se llame en tu interfaz. No hay algoritmos que destaquen publicaciones, el algoritmo somos todos nosotros.
  • Usa los marcadores para guardar una publicación sin notificar al autor. Nadie podrá ver tus marcadores. Si el autor ha configurado la eliminación automática de sus publicaciones, desaparecerán de tus favoritos, pero no de los marcadores.
  • Existen varias líneas temporales:
    • Inicio, donde ves la actividad de la gente a la que sigues, incluyendo las interacciones entre ellos y sus retoots. Los mensajes directos también aparecerán en Inicio.
    • Notificaciones: aquí aparecerá cualquier interacción contigo: retoots, menciones, mensajes directos, personas que te siguen o marcan como favorito uno de tus toots.
    • Local: contiene los toots públicos de los miembros de la instancia, y sólo los toots. No incluye menciones o retoots.
    • Federada: contiene los toots locales, y los toots de todos los usuarios de otras instancias seguidos por usuarios de tu instancia. La línea federada es un buen lugar en el que encontrar gente conocida, y conocer gente nueva. Procura no perderla de vista. Si la instancia se conecta a un repetidor, como es nuestro caso, la federada es una combinación de las federadas de todas las instancias unidas a ese repetidor.
    • Mensajes directos: contiene los mensajes directos agrupados en conversaciones. Recientemente ha cambiado su nomenclatura para llamarse "sólo la gente a la que menciono".
  • Hay cuatro tipos de publicaciones:
    • Pública: llega a todas partes. Aparece en la línea local y la federada.
    • No listada: no se muestra en las líneas local y federada, pero cualquiera que abra tu perfil o te siga la encontrará porque sigue accesible al público.
    • Sólo seguidores: sólo las personas que te siguen podrán leerla. Si alguien te sigue después de que hayas publicado, también tendrá acceso a ese contenido.
    • Directa o sólo la gente que menciono: sólo la persona o personas mencionadas podrán leerla. Es muy fácil enviar mensajes directos grupales.
  • Los mensajes directos no van cifrados. Los administradores de las instancias involucradas en una conversación podrían leerlos si quisieran. No envíes información que consideres confidencial.
  • Explora las tendencias disponibles para encontrar personas con tus mismos intereses. Puedes seguir etiquetas si lo deseas.
  • Sigue al administrador de tu instancia, y procura respetar las reglas. Si no te convencen, siempre puedes migrar a otra instancia más adecuada para ti.
  • Los recursos no son ilimitados. Para alargar la vida de la instancia y facilitar su administración, configura un umbral de eliminación automática de publicaciones en las opciones de tu cuenta. Te lo agradeceremos infinitamente.
  • Si quieres que los demás te encuentren con facilidad, no descuides tu perfil. La casilla "Sugerir esta cuenta a otros" es especialmente interesante, y viene desmarcada por defecto.
  • Describe cualquier contenido multimedia que subas. No sólo imágenes, también audios y vídeos. Nunca se sabe quién podría necesitar una alternativa textual.
  • Si quieres redactar un hilo, responde a tu publicación anterior, y así sucesivamente. Procura poner el primer toot como público, y el resto como no listados.
  • Si echas de menos Twitter, existe un espejo llamado bird.makeup que te lo mostrará. Sigue a @usuario@bird.makeup, donde usuario es el nombre de usuario de Twitter deseado. Los tuits suelen llegar con retraso. La persona no se enterará de que la has seguido ni verá tus respuestas.
  • Si quieres informarte, algunos medios de comunicación están ya en el fediverso, pero otros no. Intentamos remediarlo con el proyecto FediFeed.
  • Mastodon tiene una app oficial para móviles, pero no pienses que por ello está mejor preparada u ofrece funciones únicas. Hay aplicaciones de terceros que te pueden venir mejor, dales una oportunidad.
  • Si crees que una de tus publicaciones puede herir la sensibilidad de alguien, marca la casilla de contenido sensible y escribe un breve texto de advertencia.
  • Aunque en otras redes sociales no has pagado nada, nunca fueron gratis. Mastodon tampoco lo es. Pregunta al administrador de tu instancia si necesita dinero para financiarla y, si es así, intenta contribuir en la medida de tus posibilidades. Tristemente, dejar atrás algoritmos y publicidad tiene sus consecuencias.
  • Algunas apps ofrecen la posibilidad de citar publicaciones. Dicha función es exclusiva de esas apps, pero no de Mastodon. Procura siempre que puedas responder en vez de citar. De esa forma, todo el mundo podrá participar sin barreras.

Recomendaciones para usuarios de lectores de pantalla

 Si tus ojos se encuentran fuera de servicio permanentemente, seguramente estarás usando uno o varios lectores de pantalla. Sigue estas recomendaciones para sacarle todo el partido posible a Mastodon:
  • Si vas a usar Mastodon desde su web, en las preferencias de tu cuenta, activa la vista avanzada. A continuación, despliega tantos hilos como quieras, y fíjalos. Para ello, abre la configuración que se encuentra bajo el encabezado de nivel 1 en cada uno.
  • Olvídate del cursor virtual o el modo exploración. Puede que tengas que emplearlo, pero en casos muy puntuales. Apóyate en el modo foco, las flechas y los diversos atajos de teclado de Mastodon. Estando en modo foco, pulsa el signo cerrar interrogación, pasa al modo exploración y pulsa la t para ir a la siguiente tabla. Allí verás todas las teclas rápidas.
  • Si tienes iPhone o Mac, instala Mona. Se trata de una aplicación muy completa y accesible con VoiceOver. Es de pago, pero merece la pena. También dispones de otras apps gratuitas que puedes probar, como la oficial de Mastodon, Tusker, IceCubes o Metatext. Este último está abandonado.
  • Si tienes Android, instala la app oficial de Mastodon, Tusky, Megalodon o Fedilab. Esta última es de pago.
  • En Windows, puedes usar TWBlue. La línea federada deberás habilitarla desde Opciones de cuenta, en la pestaña buffers.
  • En cualquier plataforma, también tienes a tu disposición el cliente web Pinafore. Actualmente está abandonado, pero su autor cree que se podrá usar con Mastodon durante una buena temporada. Se maneja de forma similar a la web, pero ofrece más información accesible. Existe una bifurcación suya, llamada Semaphore, centrada exclusivamente en la accesibilidad, y otra más reciente, Enafore.

¿Nos echas una mano?

Al igual que el resto de servicios que ofrecemos, esta instancia funciona gracias a las donaciones que recibimos de particulares y empresas. Si quieres contribuir con una cantidad, por pequeña que sea, visita nuestra página de donaciones.
Short: Una instancia de propósito general para interactuar con el fediverso mediante Mastodon, ofrecida y administrada por la comunidad hispanohablante de NVDA.

Description:
Welcome

mastodon.skrimmage.com is Mastodon instance with the central theme of sports analytics, but open to all people who want to have a friendly and respectful place regardless of your fandom.

Registration eligibility

We accept registrations from any person aged 18+. While we do not require the use of any particular language, moderators may use automated translation services to spot-check posts and ensure adherence to our Code of Conduct.

Please include a full description for why you wish to join and who invited you to join. Users may be silenced until verify that they don't wish to spam or harass.

Mastodon Server Covenant Commitment

We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  • Daily backups of user data.
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.

Our mission

We have a mission to make mastodon.skrimmage.com a safe and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of their gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, mental or physical disability, political views, and personal appearance.

We are resolute in protecting the mastodon.skrimmage.com community from harassment and malicious content from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.
Short: Skrimmage is a friendly community of sports enthusiasts! Let's make this a welcoming environment for all those who want to enjoy discussing sports, analytics, and sports analytics.

Description: Poliverso è oggi la più grande istanza Friendica italiana, nata per offrire un social network senza limiti di caratteri, integrato nel Fediverso e dotato di funzionalità avanzate: uno spazio politico, poliedrico e policentrico in cui discutere i temi dell'attualità e, in particolare, privacy, diritti digitali, diritto alla conoscenza e open source.

Description:
The Illuminati

Look, we're not actually the Illuminati. Not that we'd tell you if we were, but we're not. I mean, we could be, but we're not. Really. We don't know the first thing about imminentizing any eschatons, and if we did, we wouldn't tell you, because we're not the Illuminati. We're not even sure what an eschaton is, and we assure you we have not imminentized any. Recently. That we’re willing to talk about. But enough about us!

This is just a chill server for generalists. Rules subject to change without notice. Capriciousness likely. Be excellent to each other. Exercise skepticism. Try to avoid imminentizing any eschatons, but if you absolutely must, please do so esotericlaly.
Short: The Illuminati! On Mastadon! Or maybe not. Maybe just some random people interested in various things. Exercise skepticism.

Description:
Welcome

deacon.social is a server intended for Christians of all backgrounds and faith traditions to build an inclusive and loving community. We do not all agree about everything, and we do not want this to be an echo chamber, but we will treat each other respectfully in the face of disagreement. Some of us are deconstructing/reconstructing. Some of us are struggling to find where we belong.

Members are expected to abide by the server rules at all times. Content that violates the server rules should be reported to the moderators. A violation of rules on this server will result in disciplinary action. Users from other servers who violate the rules of our community may be banned from this server and likely reported to the admin of their server as well.

The name deacon (διακονέω) means one who serves or "server," and since this is a server, and our goal is to serve each other, the name is doubly appropriate.

Supporting the server

We have an Open Collective for deacon.social. We use this service to track the expenses incurred for operating the server. Contribution is completely optional, but if you enjoy using this server, we would appreciate you giving back!
Short: A respectful, loving, and diverse community of Christians of all traditions

Description:
Ein Zitat von Dietrich Bonhoeffer "Konspiration und Haft 1940–1945"

Das Freisein von etwas erfährt seine Erfüllung erst in dem Freisein für etwas. Freisein allein um des Freiseins willen aber führt zur Anarchie. Freiheit bedeutet biblisch: Freisein für den Dienst an Gott und am Nächsten, Freisein für den Gehorsam gegen die Gebote Gottes. Das setzt voraus: Freisein von jedem inneren und äußeren Zwang, der uns an diesem Dienst hindert. Freiheit bedeutet also nicht Auflösung aller Autorität, sondern es bedeutet: leben innerhalb der durch Gottes Wort geordneten und begrenzten Autoritäten und Bindungen.
Die Frage der individuellen Freiheiten, wie Redefreiheit, Pressefreiheit, Versammlungsfreiheit etc. ist erst in diesem übergeordneten Zusammenhang zu beantworten. Es kommt darauf an, wieweit diese Freiheiten notwendig und geeignet sind, die Freiheit des Lebens nach den Geboten Gottes zu fördern und sicherzustellen. Freiheit ist eben nicht in erster Linie ein individuelles Recht, sondern eine Verantwortung, Freiheit ist nicht in erster Linie ausgerichtet am Individuum, sondern am Nächsten.
Short: Wir bieten einen kleinen Gemeinschaftsraum zum Thema Bibel und Schöpfer. Die primäre Sprache ist Deutsch.

Description:
listen, this was just a bad joke that i bought the domain name for on a lark. it's a functional lark, though.

Accounts

Registration is not public, mostly vibes-based and limited to people we know and can reasonably verify the identity of. If you'd like an account, please us know who you are and how we might know you in the comment box when you're signing up.

See the Terms of Service for more.

Description:
La comunidad malaga.social es un punto de encuentro para malaguitas que forma parte de Mastodon, una red social libre y descentralizada.

Desde malaga.social puedes conectar con cualquier persona de la red global de Mastodon, de manera independiente a su servidor, porque somos una instancia federada. Además participarás en la comunidad local malaga.social dónde esperamos tratar todo tipo de temas con acento malagueño.

No hay reglas preestablecidas, malaga.social será lo que queramos que sea, la construiremos entre todos los que formemos parte de ella. Esperamos que sea una comunidad basada en el respeto a los demás, para lo que contamos con la sabiduría e inestimable ayuda de nuestra administradora Tima.
Short: La comunidad malaga.social es un punto de encuentro para malaguitas. Forma parte de Mastodon, una red social global, libre, federada y descentralizada.

Description:
Established 2022.

mefi.social is a Mastodon instance for Metafilter. It's unofficial - it's not controlled or owned by Metafilter. Everyone on here was verified as a Metafilter member.

It's not intended as a replacement for Metafilter or Metatalk.

invites

Request an invitation to join, by MeFi Mail to:

  • username "mefi dot social"
  • or to Pronoiac, who runs the joint

custom emoji

See all of our custom emoji at emojos.in. We've imported sets of emoji:

  • Queer Butterfly Emoji from FrazzledBrynn

  • RPG dice from dice.camp

  • Victor Wynne's "Old Man Yells at" emoji

blocklists

Most of our blocks are imported from a Tier 0 blocklist from Oliphant.social; it's a high level of consensus of a list of the worst instances on the Fediverse. Our blocklist is displayed only to logged-on members, so that people keeping score of how much they're blocked, can't.

A couple more places are silenced or limited. The effect is like putting up fences, that people can talk over, but which prevent swarms.

  • Threads, from Facebook / Meta / Instagram, has been silenced / limited since before its release. (As of 2023-11, it's not federated yet.)
  • If and when the BBC instance includes reporters.

We're running Hometown, which is currently based on a slightly older version of Mastodon; we lack the Mastodon v4.2 options to allow or disallow keyword searching of our public posts.
Short:
mefi.social is a Mastodon instance for Metafilter - https://metafilter.com .
It's unofficial - it's not controlled or owned by Metafilter.
Everyone on here was verified as a Metafilter member.

Description:
Welcome

Welcome to the PostChat community on Mastodon! We provide a place for Postproduction professionals & friends to discuss topics related to filmmaking, production, postproduction, tech, life, and more. First and foremost, we're about building community, and that doesn't always involve technical discussion, so feel free to go off-topic and have fun.

Sponsor our server

If you'd like to sponsor this server, go to https://cre8ivebeast.com/postchat and choose any of our options there.

Who's Behind This?

Cre8ive Beast led by Felipe Baez is the owner of this server, deployed for the public benefit of the production and postproduction area.
Short: A place for all postproduction professionals, enthusiasts and anyone who wants to be part of Mastodon.
