Description:
Tabletop gaming chatter in a moderated space. An inclusive community we'd like to hang out in. Not run by a billionaire.

We're making a little friendly Twitter clone using Mastodon which is for #ttrpg (and other tabletop). Like Twitter but with moderation and not owned by a billionaire.

Needs some work yet, but if we get it going we imagine it will be a small friendly inclusive community (we're not planning on taking over the world with it, just making a nice space we'd like to hang out in).

Responsible, representative moderation would be nice, too.
Short: Tabletop gaming chatter in a moderated space. An inclusive community we'd like to hang out in.

Description:
Welcome to 438 PUNK HOUSE

438punk.house is a Mastodon instance intending to serve punks, queers, anarchists and our friends who are based in Tiohtià:ke aka Montreal, Quebec, Canada.

Our intention is for this instance to serve users who are based in Montreal. So, locals only please. If you are looking for an anarchist instance with open registration, we recommend kolektiva.social.

What is Mastodon?

Here is a cute video that explains what Mastodon is:

Mastodon is one implementation of the Fediverse, which is a network of 1000s of servers of a dozen or so different social media applications which all talk to each other to form a federated network. Anyone can run a server (called an instance), and all the instances in the fediverse share messages with each other. This allows users on different instances to follow and message each other. It's like how you can have an email address @gmail.com and your friend can be @riseup.net and you can still send emails to each other. The users and administrators of any instance can decide their own internal guidelines about how to behave and what to post, and which other instances they want to interact with (or block interactions with).

We chose to use a fork of Mastodon over other options because it is the most widely adopted and the most user-friendly and is supported by many mobile apps. The fork we are running is called Hometown and it gives us a few extra features over regular Mastodon.

On Mastodon, there are no ads, there is very little in th way of an algorithm feeding you posts, and you have greater control over your user data. There are numerous other really nice features that other social media doesn't have:

  • Individual privacy control for each post
  • Content warnings
  • Image descriptions
  • Many controls for safety and filtering
  • An easy place to include pronouns on your profile
  • No ads

There is plenty of documentation on Mastodon, how it works, and how to use it here. But we have some of our own documentation further down in the page under USER GUIDE

What is 438 PUNK HOUSE?

438punk.house is our attempt to get more of our friends on Montreal using Mastodon and the Fediverse instead of corporate social media for the punk-adjacent online social connection, including for promoting and talking about shows and music. But really it will be up to the users what the instance gets used for.

This is our first time trying to run a server like this. So there might be some hiccups. We host and manage the server ourselves. Right now we are fronting the costs (which are very small). If the instance becomes more popular, we may ask for donations or run some benefits to help cover the server costs.

GUIDELINES

We are anarchists so we don't like rules, but there are guidelines to help maintain the sustainability and health of the instance. These may change as things go on. Please contact @admin@438punk.house if you have input or suggestions!

Please note that if you disagree with any of these guidelines in theory or practice, you are welcome to set up your own Mastodon instance with your own guidelines/rules!

Don't post content that is flatly racist, sexist, transphobic, homophobic, ableist, misogynistic, or otherwise bigoted.

This will defacto include any symbols, slogans, memes/jokes, or vapid talking points of the reactionary far right. Don't be an edge-lord either.

Don't use your account to harass or troll other users on 438punk.house.

Don't use your account to harass or troll other users on other instances.

When interacting with users out in the broader fediverse, you represent 438punk.house to some extent (it shows up at the end of your username, after all!). So avoid trolling or harassing other users, even if they are on other instances. This can lead to other instances blanket blocking (defederating) with 438punk.house which is usually bad. If you pick fights with bad people, they can also follow you back to 438punk.house and harass other users here - if you want to pick fights on Mastodon, even with bad people, consider launching those attacks from your own instance and not from here!

Don't use your account to harass or troll regular people in general.

Become familiar with the privacy and account moderation settings on Mastodon and use them.

Every post on Mastodon has its own individual privacy setting that you set when you make the post. You also have many ways to deal with unwanted content/users. You can filter posts by tag or keywords, mute or block users, block an entire instance, and report problems to moderators. More info here.

Don't post any illegal content, or talk about illegal acts, or otherwise post anything that could cause legal trouble for the server (where your images and posts live).

It's a stupid idea to do that here for your own safety, but also don't bring the heat to the punk house. Go smoke down the block.

Use Content Warnings for the following types of content

  • Nudity
  • Gore
  • Drug use/paraphernalia
  • Text detailing a sexual act
  • Text mentioning suicide, self-harm, abust, rape, or sexual assault
  • Spoilers

When it doubt, it's easy to include a Content Warning, so why not err on the side of caution? It's polite!

Try to use Image Descriptions

Mastodon allows the easy appending of image descriptions to any image being posted. This is more of a strong suggestion than a firm guideline - but consider writing an image description every time you post an image. Image descriptions are very helpful to anyone who uses a screen reader, and offer many other benefits to a lot of users. It's a bit of a polite social norm here - a lot of users will not boost your posts if you do not include an image description. And it's easy and fun once you get used to it!

USER GUIDE

438punk.house runs on Hometown which is a fork of Mastodon. Here is the official documentation for Mastodon. Here is the official documentation for Hometown.

Consider especially consulting the following sections of the official documentation:

  • Dealing with unwanted content
  • Promoting yourself and others

Because we are running a fork, we have all the features of Mastodon, plus a few extra features that Hometown gives us. If you really want to know everything, read the Mastodon docs above, and then the Hometown docs after! This user guide will be based on the specific set up we have here, and may not apply to a user on a different instance, where they may not be running Hometown, regular Mastodon, a different fork of Mastodon, or one of many other apps that make up part of the Fediverse!

Mobile Apps

There are a variety of ways to connect to 438punk.house and use Mastodon. You can connect using your browser (probably like you are right now). Using Mastodon through a browser is the most powerful way to use it. There are a few more options, you can configure more of your preferences, and it's a lot easier to find and follow new people. You can use the web-browser version on your mobile phone and it works quite well.

There are also a couple of really good mobile apps. We suggest Tusky or Fedilab for Android, and Metatext or Toot! (not free) for iOS. Mastodon also has 'Official' apps for iOS and Android. These official apps are very nice and easy if you are new to Mastodon/the Fediverse but please not they are missing certain crucial features! Consider trying them out first and then 'upgrading' to using one of the other apps once you get the hang of things. Besides the apps lists, there are actually lots of others. If you find one you like better, let us know! You can always use Mastodon in a browser on your phone if all else fails!

Note that whatever app you are using, how different parts of Mastodon look and work will depend on how the people who made the app implemented them. So it may not be exactly as it is explained in this guide, or in official documentation for Mastodon or Hometown.

Please note when using these apps, you must have have already created an account here, at 438punk.house using your web browser. When connecting an app to your account here, you need to tell the app three things, the instance you are on (438punk.house), your username, and your password. Many apps will default to the instance mastodon.social if you do not provide you own instance. This is the biggest instance run by the developers of Mastodon, and you probably don't want to be there. Logging in won't work if you don't properly indicate your instance!

Timelines

Mastodon has 4 different timelines, or feeds, of posts (although some mobile apps may not show you all four timelines).

Home Timeline

This is the feed of posts from people you follow. You'll see all their public posts, follower-only posts, unlisted posts, boosts, etc.

Local Timeline

This timeline is everything happening on 438punk.house. All the public posts by users on our instance only.

Federated or Global Timeline

This timeline will show a lot of random stuff. It's all the public posts that our instance 'knows about' from tne entire fediverse. So all the public posts on 438punk.house, and from users of many other instances. What gets in here depends on the interacts the users of 438punk.house have made with other instances. People they follow, or posts they have commented on, or posts that people they follow have commented on... etc. There's no algorithm selected or sorting these posts, it's just a chronological feed of all these posts that have come to our instance through the magic of federation. It hasn't happened yet but in theory some offensive stuff could show up here from other instances. If that does happen, please flag it with a moderation report so we can block those instances if appropriate!

Direct Messages

This timeline will show all the posts that are set to Direct Message/People Mentioned Only

Toots aka Posts

The main thing you do on Mastodon is post. You follow people and see their posts. People follow you and see your posts. You cna boost posts. You can reply to posts. Posts used to be called Toots (as in, the sound a mastodon makes) and thenthey changed it to Post. RIP Toots.

Unlike on regular Mastodon, our post character limit is currently 1312 characters.

There are different options available when making a post.

Attachments

You can attach images, photos, or videos to your posts. Videos have to be pretty short.

Once an image is done uploading, you will see a preview of your image. If you click 'Edit' in the corner you can add an image description.

Content Warning

You have the option of adding a content warning to your post by clicking the CW. The body of your post will be hidden until a user clicks 'Show More'. Whatever you write as the content warning will appear above the 'Show More' button. Please use content warnings for any of the types of content mentioned in the guidelines. But you can also use them other things you have deemed appropriate for content warnings, but also as a way to hide some content from the user, for example for long posts, or for a joke, or to simply indicate the topic of your post.

Emojis

Mastodon has a built in emoji picker, and you will find many custom emojis that we have added ourselves. If you use these custom emojis they will be visible to anyone seeing your post, even users outside 438punk.house. If you want to see a specific emoji added, either one you've seen users on other instances using, or one you want us to make custom, just message @admin@438punk.house with your request!

Post Privacy Setting

Clicking the globe lets you bring up the post privacy setting. These settings determine who can see your post.

Public: This post will appear in the Public and Local timelines, as well as the Home timelines of everyone who follows you. It will also be visible on your profile and every user on the fediverse, or anyone browsing to your profile on the internet can potentially see this post there.

Unlisted: This post will not appear on the Public or Local timelines, but it will be visible in the Home timelines of everyone who follows you. It will also be visible on your profile and every user on the fediverse, or anyone browsing to your profile on the internet can potentially see this post there. This is useful for posting in a thread, where you don't want to clutter up public timelines with every post in the thread.

Followers Only: This post will only be visible to your followers, in their Home timelines or if they are looking at your profile. Not that if you have not locked your account, anyone could follow you without your approval and thus see these posts.

Mentioned People Only: aka Direct Messages. Only the users mentioned by @ in the post will be able to see it. This is the closest Mastodon has to direct or private messages, but rather than thinking of it like a DM, think of as what it literally is: a post that only the people mentioned can see. These posts are not encrypted, if you need to make sneaky encrypted messages, use a messaging platform dedicated to that purpose!

Local Only Posting

Because we are running Hometown, we have an additional Post Privacy Setting which is the posts "Federation" status. This isn't in the post privacy picker explained above, but is selected with the little chain icon.

Federated (the chain is unbroken) means that your post will federate to other instances all across the fediverse, while also respecting whatever Post Privacy Settings you've selected.

Local Only (the chain is broken) means that your post will only be visible to users on this instance, while also respecting whatever Post Privacy Settings you've selected.

Mobile apps do not currently support this little chain picker, but if you are posting from an app you can use the special :local_only: emoji (the little punkhouse with 438 written on it) to make a post Local Only!

Tips for new users!

Here are some tips for new users of 438punk.house to optimize your landing here!

If you are coming from one of the mainstream social media networks like Instagram, Facebook or Twitter, there is definitely some culture shock.

First of all, a pep talk: give Mastodon an honest effort. Regular social media wasn't easy to get used to the first time you used it, but over many years it has trained your brain. Mastodon is different and it will feel very different at first. If you don't give it an honest effort, you won't get anything out of it either.

One thing that is important when you create a new account is to fill in some basic info in your profile. Remember this profile is public, so act accordingly. You need to include some info about yourself (pronouns are a good idea) and what you are interested in if you want to meet some strangers (no one follows-back an empty profile with 0 posts). You need to include some kind of info if you want your friends to find you and know who it is.

A popular thing to do here when you are feeling comfortable is to make an #introduction post (using that hashtag). Check out that hashtag in the search bar for some ideas. You can pin this post to your profile so people can always see it, and it's something other users can boost for you so that people who might be interested in following you can find you!

When you first create an account, there is a good chance you will have trouble finding any content on your timeline at all. It will be shockingly empty. Mastodon has no real recommendation algorithm. Mastodon will not do much work for you to find content or users to follow. It can be a bit of a shock to have to do all that work yourself, but remember that the plus-side is there is no algorithm analyzing all your content and deciding who/what to recommend to you. You are in full control of who you follow and what posts you see in your home timeline.

A good way to find people to follow on 438punk.house is to find a few friends (hopefully you know some who brought you here). Look at who they follow and who follows them, look for your other friends! Another good place to look is the Local timeline. This will show you all posts from other people on 438punk.house - have a look and start following!

Being on here you are also not just on 438punk.house. We are part of the greater fediverse. There are many other instances like ours full of anarchists, queers, weirdos, people who post cat pictures, etc. You can see a lot of this on the Global Timeline. Exploring this world is a lot easier on a browser logged into your account. For example, the profile directory lets you see users who have opted to be listed either on our instance, or in the known fediverse (on all instances that 438punk.house knows about). There are lots of interesting people there (especially anarchists, queers, and nerds).

The last thing is to use it! Post and interact. Everyone here is also new. Any social interactions (liking, replying, boosting) go a long way to building the social network. So get tootin'!

Safety

The fediverse is a big place. Right now 438punk.house is pretty young and small, so we are not federated with that many other instances, and instances we are federated with are for the most part pretty cool places. As the instances grows, there will be more and more federation with other instances. It's a big world out there, and anyone can run a Mastodon instance. There are corners of the fediverse that are far-right, or trolls, or spam-bots, or lolita porn. We can (and will) blanket block any instances that cater to users and content like that, and we have already preemptively blocked a long list of known bad-instances. But it is worth being aware that that stuff can pop up in the Global timeline. It's very helpful if you report that kind of stuff using the built in Moderation tools so that we can take appropriate action.

On Mastodon you have much more control over your data, but you should also be aware of what the limits are for your own safety, security, and privacy. Your profile and any public posts are visible by anyone. All of your posts and content is stored on our server in an unencrypted way. The server keeps all kinds of logs. Direct messages are not end-to-end encrypted and should not be used for anything that requires security, or extreme privacy. Use Signal if you need that.

Other things we want to add to this guide

  • Our special hashtags
  • Finding and following people on other instances
  • Using lists for fun and success
  • All the fun things you can set in settings
  • Why sometimes you won't see all the replies to a post, or all the posts on a profile from a different instance

Mastodon-Instanz für PrePedia, meta.prepedia.org

Diese Instanz wurde insbesonders für das Projekt FediNINA erstellt, siehe fedinina.prepedia.org

FediNINA ist ein PrePedia-Projekt, das die Informationen des Bundesamt für Bevölkerungsschutz und Katastrophenhilfe für die einzelnen, Regionen, Kreise und Städte inoffiziell in das Fediverse bringt.

Description:
triangletoot.party

This Mastodon instance is intended for those who have an interest in the Triangle region of North Carolina. You aren't required to live here in order to join, but please mention why you want to join triangletoot.party in particular if you apply to join. There are lots of general instances out there, and your request will be denied if you give a generic response to that question. If you have a friend who is already a part of this server, they can send you an invite.

Getting started

This official Mastodon guide will help explain all the different parts of Mastodon, but here's a quick rundown:

  • Toot* = post (like Twitter's tweet)
  • Boost = show that post on your profile (like Twitter's retweet)
  • Favorite = show appreciation for a post (like Twitter's like)
  • Home = posts from people you follow
  • Local = posts from everybody on triangletoot.party
  • Federated = posts from everybody known to triangletoot.party

Suggested first steps

  • Add a profile picture
  • Post a toot! Tell us a little bit about yourself and make sure to add the #introduction tag to your post so others can find you.
  • Filter out languages to your liking (especially useful for the federated timeline)
  • Browse the local and federated timelines for people to follow

How do I find people to follow?

  • Browse local profiles to find users on triangletoot.party.
  • Check out Trunk to find individuals.
  • Check out Guppe to find and follow people with similar interests.

Funding

This instance is funded by @autumn@triangletoot.party. Donations for running the server and moderation can be made here: https://liberapay.com/triangletoot.party.

Prohibited content

This content is prohibited by the hosting service, Masto.host.

  • Illegal activity
  • Sexual content involving minors, including artistic depictions
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • National Socialism
  • Nazism
  • Holocaust denial
  • Racism
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gender-critical
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Transphobia
  • Misogyny
  • Pro-ana / Pro-mia
  • Automated sharing of third-party content, news sources, websites or social media content that doesn’t belong to you
  • Trolling, insulting and derogatory comments towards others outside your server
  • Mass following and aggregation of content

Credits

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.

Footnotes

* Toots are now called "posts" in the codebase, but colloquially they are still sometimes referred to as toots.
Short: Mastodon instance focused on the Triangle region of North Carolina. Keeping out jerks since 2019. Anti-racist, anti-fascist, and anti-TERF.

Description:
Values

Mastodon Transit Authority builds community and solidarity. We welcome those interested in building thriving communities online and in real-life throughout the Puget Sound Region. We are organizers, nerdy about transit, renters, union members, tech workers, musicians, neighbors, climate activists, mutual aid participants; we are passionate about mobility justice, a right to housing, and cross-race / cross-class / cross-generational / intersectional communities. We endeavor to welcome anyone making a long- or short-term stay here, and make this instance your home.

Code of Conduct

We want people to be curious. To ask questions rather than start with accusations. We also want people to recognize power dynamics and lived experience in terms of their expectations in engaging in online spaces, as they would in face-to-face spaces. If you don’t already practice progressive stack in communities you are in, please take some time to learn what that means and how to implement it. It goes a long way to reducing harm when you’re just starting to build community in person, and online.

We will take swift and clear steps to reduce harmful behaviors. We know harm will happen and we want to make sure you can get help when it does. Moderators on this server will move quickly and seek out additional supports to remove and deter accounts that:

Espouse, or sealion ideals destructive to other people’s well-being, including but not limited to:

  • Violence, racism, classism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, anti-semitism, fascism, ecofascism, ethno-nationalism, settler colonialism, religious extremism, neurotype supremacy

Carry out online behaviors that harm, or emotionally exhaust other people:

  • harassment, brigading (including posts that may encourage others to harass), sealioning, doxxing (weaponization of private information disclosure, such as disclosing or publicizing addresses, email, phone numbers, medical history, private identifying information, etc without consent), spamming, slander, spreading misinformation/disinformation, privacy and consent violations (taking screenshots of “locked” / private-to-follower posts and sharing them publicly without the author’s consent)

Denial of service, proper server operation, and other members’ content readability, including:

  • Running automation or bots in a way that overloads the server, or is unpleasantly noisy for other users

This server is hosted in Washington state, United States and content must not violate local laws.

99% of the time, these rules will not be needed because the people here and in the broader community will be awesome. There's always the chance they aren't, so we have rules. Finally, if you run into a problem, reach out to an admin! Someone can probably fix what ails the server or tell you what's going on.

Technical Safety and Privacy

Because of how Mastodon works, no stored communications here are encrypted. Even things that appear private to you, like direct messages or restricted account posts, are not private relative to the server administrators. Server admins are not allowed, by rule of the server owner, to read this content; however this is enforced only by rule. The admins will treat your data with respect and privacy but if you want to make certain no one is able to see your communications with another person, consider other alternatives such as Signal.

While the instance is backed up regularly, please keep a copy of your own data in case the worst happens.

Moderators and Advisors

This instance has six volunteer administrators and moderators who tend to the server, the software, and keeping posts flowing that are consistent with our rules and values. These folks are, in order by user name: @analogist, @Andres4NY (an admin for the underlying server host and not the instance), @danielhep, @kona, @oowm, @rachael. We will do our best to keep an eye on things, particularly abuse reports. There might be a delay in replying if something major happens or if one or all of us are away.

If this list of people changes, we will make an announcement post to let the community know. If you report a post or user, all of us receive it. Any admin can take action on their own, particularly in urgent situations, but we discuss major actions beforehand.

If you have questions for or want to run something past someone who isn't an admin, you can reach out to Laura Loe of Share the Cities Organizing Collective, our IRL organizing home, at info@sharethecities.org

Potentially Harmful Servers

Content Warning! Abusive server names The list of servers and rationale that have been moderated from federation is accessible here.
Short: We are organizers, transit riders, renters, union members, tech workers, musicians, climate activists; we are passionate about mobility justice, a right to housing, and intersectional communities.

Description:
First of all, welcome

This is a social community inspired by the Wheel of Time. Talk about anything, connect with people and interests across the open social web, and swear your body and soul to the Great Lord of the Dark.

Open social web, what does that mean?

Mastodon is one of a few platforms that support the fediverse, the concept of inter-connected social media applications and servers. So while we may choose to find a home on a relatively small fandom-themed server, we can still engage with people and posts from the larger servers.

How do I find people?

Once you have an account, you will be able to see activity that takes place here on this server using the Local timeline. You can find and engage with anybody local that way.

There is also the Federated timeline, which shows posts from people on other servers. As we engage with people from other servers, those peoples' content will also start surfacing in our Federated timeline and in Search. If you see something in the Federated timeline, you can also engage with it there the same way as you would if it were local.

If you really want to branch out, you can often view the public timelines of some of the larger servers. This allows you to explore the discussions taking place there, and potentially find new and interesting people to follow and engage with. They will just give you a URL for you to enter into search here so that you can engage with the content from your home server.

There are also browser plugins and mobile apps which make it easier to engage with content from other servers. Roam with Mastodon is a browser extension we recommend for this purpose. Find other servers here

Always feel free to ask

Testing new technologies and new platforms can be a lot of fun. It can also be frustrating and confusing at times. Please always feel free to ask questions if you're confused about something or don't know how to do something that you think you should be able to do. For those new to Mastodon, I put together a short thread demonstrating some of what Mastodon posts look like and can do. This is not a comprehensive tutorial, and questions are always welcome.

How is this funded?

Darkfriend Social is paid for by our generous users and the server admin. Donating through Ko-Fi or PayPal using the links below will help to pay the monthly hosting costs. See the Ko-Fi page for a description of costs and current funding goal.

 

Updates for the Darkfriend Social community, server, and funding will be posted to our blog at blog.darkfriend.social. This blog is also federated, which means that you can follow @updates@blog.darkfriend.social.

Wheel of Time chapter icons have been downloaded from http://wot.wikia.com/wiki/Category:Chapter_art, and are under the same license.

Code of Conduct

Moderation Team

Our moderation team members are:

  • @hybridhavoc

If you would like to volunteer to join the moderation team, email hybridhavoc@darkfriend.social with some details on what motivated you to volunteer and how you view the role of content moderaters. We may not always be looking to expand the moderation team.

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the moderators. They'll respond as promptly as they can. Utilize the report function or email abuse@darkfriend.social.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we’ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the moderators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from this community and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Harassment

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person’s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‘dead’ or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where they’re not appropriate
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like “hug” or “backrub”) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication

Advertisements and Promotions

Advertisements are considered to be any promotion of products or services for sale, either for money or other form of barter, that are not directly related to the primary topic of this community (The Wheel of Time) or to an ongoing discussion.

Exceptions include merchandise products or other services that:

  • are officially licensed Wheel of Time properties
  • are from or related to Wheel of Time fan creators
  • otherwise are freely available to all

Rules against advertising pertain to local accounts only. If you encounter unwanted advertising in your own feed or in the federated feed, please unfollow and/or block the account as needed.

Moderation Guide

joyeusenoelle on Github was kind enough to put together a Guide to Mastodon Moderation which outlines the tools available to Mastodon moderators. This is good reading for anybody that is or wants to be a moderator of a Mastodon community.

  • Local accounts that violate Rule 1 will be Suspended.
  • Repeat offenders of Rules 2 - 5 may have their posts force-marked sensitive, their accounts Limited, and/or Suspended.
  • Local accounts that violate Rules 6 or 7 may have their accounts Limited and/or Suspended.

Federation

We utilize the tier 0 server blocklist from Oliphant and the Fedi Council. In addition, we subscribe to the #FediBlock hashtag and investigate reported servers. If evidence of content that would violate our rules is readily available either on the server's public timeline, on the server admin's personal timeline, or there are additional details that we feel warrant action, the server is moderated accordingly.

  • Servers that host a number repeat offenders of Rule 2 may be Limited.
  • Servers that host a number of repeat offenders of Rule 3 may be Suspended.
  • Servers that host a number of repeat offenders of Rule 4 may be Limited and/or have their media files rejected.
  • Servers that host a number of repeat offenders of Rule 5 may be Limited and/or Suspended.
  • Servers that are the source of spam waves may be Limited. Spam is determined at the discretion of the moderation team.

Moderated server obfuscation

In the list(s) of moderated servers, we choose to obfuscate server names when their names themselves are deemed hateful or objectionable. If you would like to know the full server name for any of the obfuscated servers below, please contact an admin or moderator.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy. We have adapted the Sample Slack Code of Conduct for our own use under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License.

Description:
myTransponder

Making Aviation Social

myTransponder.com is a home on Mastodon for those who love aviation. Our members are pilots, flight instructors, photographers, journalists, and all-around avgeeks.

Ownership & Management

myTransponder operates on Mastodon under the myTransponder family of brands created by and managed by Rod Rakic. H. Michael Miley of Miley Performance Group, LLC. provides strategic direction and operational oversight of the technical backend.

Financials

Site funding comes from Rod, Mike, and those that support us through donations and referrals. If you find our server valuable, please donate/tip/give a bit to help offset our costs. The costs are real, and we are self-funding this effort. So, consider following a link below to give at whatever level you aspire to.

Donation Links

  • One-Time - Block time: Choose any ammount you wish to share via our stripe account
  • $3 Monthly - Private Pilot Monthly donation
  • $5 Monthly - Commercial Pilot Monthly donation
  • $8 Monthly - Air Transport Pilot Monthly donation

We are contributing 1% of all donations to Stripe's Carbon Offset efforts. Sorry, the donations are not tax deductible

Please contact Rod or Mike for sponsorship opportunities.

Referral Links

If you decide to use Digital Ocean to host your own services, please consider using our referral link:

DMCA

Our DMCA Registration Number is DMCA-1044189. DMCA Section 512 notices may be submitted ChiefPilot on the platform or by emailing ChiefPilot@mytransponder.com.

Hate Speach

Hate speech is not tolerated. This includes racism, misogyny, transphobia, homophobia, and religious intolerance such as anti-semitism. This list is illustrative but not exhaustive. You will be suspended!

Description:
Legal.Social is the Mastodon instance for legal debate.

This instance is run by my friends an myself, Malte Engeler. I am a legal professional and we are hosting as well as maintaining this instance as a hobby in our spare time.

This instance has a strict no tolerance policy against racism, sexism and hate against trans or queer people. We are trying to maintain a healthy and diverse culture and are therefor managing new accounts registrations accordingly. Please refer to the server rules, listed in the about section (in German), to see if this is the community you are looking for.

If you already have a Mastodon account anywhere else please remember that you don't need an account on this server to interact with the users here. It's called a federated social network for a reason. Consider that before asking for an invite to this instance.

The main languages of this instance are German and English

May the best argument win.

Impressum

Angaben gemäß § 5 DDG

Malte Engeler
c/o Rechtsanwalt Bremert
Tinsdaler Heideweg 48
22559 Hamburg
Telefon: 0176/93323665
E-Mail: info (at) legal (punkt) social

Verantwortlich für den Inhalt nach MStV

Malte Engeler
c/o Rechtsanwalt Bremert
Tinsdaler Heideweg 48
22559 Hamburg

Haftung für Inhalte

Als Anbieter bin ich gemäß § 7 Abs. 1 DDG für eigene Inhalte auf dieser Mastodon-Instanz nach den allgemeinen Gesetzen verantwortlich. Nach §§ 8 bis 10 DDG bin ich als Diensteanbieter jedoch nicht verpflichtet, übermittelte oder gespeicherte fremde Informationen (konkret zB Posts von Usern) zu überwachen oder nach Umständen zu forschen, die auf eine rechtswidrige Tätigkeit hinweisen. Verpflichtungen zur Entfernung oder Sperrung der Nutzung von Informationen nach den allgemeinen Gesetzen bleiben hiervon unberührt. Eine diesbezügliche Haftung ist jedoch erst ab dem Zeitpunkt der Kenntnis einer konkreten Rechtsverletzung möglich. Bei Bekanntwerden von entsprechenden Rechtsverletzungen werden ich umgehend entsprechende Schritte ergreifen.

Haftung für Links

Diese Instanz enthält Links zu externen Webseiten, auf deren Inhalte ich keinen Einfluss habe. Deshalb kann ich für diese fremden Inhalte auch keine Gewähr übernehmen. Für die verlinkten Inhalte ist stets die jeweilige Anbieterin oder Betreiberin der Seiten verantwortlich. Eine permanente inhaltliche Kontrolle der verlinkten Seiten ist ohne konkrete Anhaltspunkte einer Rechtsverletzung nicht zumutbar. Bei Bekanntwerden von Rechtsverletzungen werde ich umgehend die gebotenen Schritte ergreifen.

Urheberrecht

Die hier durch die Mastodon-User oder mich erstellten Inhalte unterliegen dem Urheberrecht. Die Vervielfältigung, Bearbeitung, Verbreitung und jede Art der Verwertung außerhalb der Grenzen des Urheberrechtes bedürfen in der Regel der schriftlichen Zustimmung der jeweiligen Autorin bzw. Erstellerin. Downloads und Kopien sind grundsätzlich nur für den privaten, nicht kommerziellen Gebrauch gestattet. Sollte eine Urheberrechtsverletzung auffallen, bitte ich um einen entsprechenden Hinweis. Bei Bekanntwerden von Rechtsverletzungen werde ich hinsichtlich derartiger Inhalte umgehend die notwendigen Schritte ergreifen.

Description:
Canadian Instances

  • mstdn.ca
  • zeroes.ca
  • TheCanadian.social
  • HalifaxSocial.ca
  • nfld.me
  • Ottawa.place
  • NewWest.social
  • Saskodon.ca

For even more Canadian instances, check this list.

Server Location

Although this is a Canadian Mastodon instance, it is hosted in France. As such, the contents of this instance may be subject to the laws of France.

Regarding Free Speech

As with mstdn.ca, we believe that freedom of speech is not freedom of reach. You are free to say whatever you want, however, we reserve the right to keep you from using our platform to say it.

Be excellent to each other!

Content Retention

Regardless of interaction, all remote content stored on this instance will be deleted after two (2) years. This includes remote replies to local posts.
Short: Canadian Mastodon Server, eh! 🇨🇦

Description:
Velkommen til Helvede, fediversets hotteste instance! Vi praktiserer mørk meme-magi og shitposter langt ind i de dybeste afgrunde. Hatespeech tolereres ikke. #helliswholesome.
Husk at læse vores serverregler og skriv hvorfor du gerne vil være med når du skriver dig op, og link evt. til andre sociale medier, så vi kan vurdere din ansøgning.
Modereres af @solgudinde og @maiathecyberwitch
Welcome to Hell, the hottest instance in the fediverse! We practice dark meme-magic and shitpost far into the abyss. Hate speech will not be tolerated. #helliswholesome
Please tell us why you want to join, and preferrably add a link to other social media, so we can review you application. Mods are @solgudinde og @maiathecyberwitch

Velkommen til Helvede, fediversets hotteste instance! Vi er en queerfeministisk server, der shitposter i den 9. cirkel.
Welcome to Hell, We’re a DK-based queerfeminist server.
Read our server rules!

Description:
Benvenuti


L'istanza Bookwyrm di Gatti Ninja è un social orientato alla lettura, alla recensione dei libri, alla condivisione delle librerie e alla creazione di comunità letterarie.

Potrete trovare spunti di lettura e di discussione, come creare una vostra lista di libri da leggere basandovi anche sui suggerimenti degli altri utenti. Leggere è sapere, ed il sapere rende liberi. Proprio per questo questa istanza non raccoglie i vostri dati, non vi traccia e non vi profila, non troverete pubblicità ed interagirete sempre e solo con esseri umani.
L'istanza è federata, quindi potete seguire e postare anche i contenuti su Mastodon, pleroma e tutto il fediverso.

Leggete il codice di comportamento per capire cosa potete e non potete fare.
Short: Istanza romana/italiana

Description:
Podemos tardar 24h en aceptar registros. Esta instancia es un proyecto que nace con sentido del humor y con el concepto de hacer amigos, pasarlo bien y permitir que los usuarios sean libres.No tenemos nada que ver con Twitter.com Nuestra moderación es ligera. Si ves un facha, contendo ilegal etc, ahí si, avisa. ¿Qué hacemos con tus datos? Nada. ¿Cómo te influye la publicidad? No tenemos. ¿Utilizamos tus datos para mejorar el servicio? No. Nunca compartiremos sus datos con nadie más, excepto en el caso de solicitudes legales válidas. (¡Esperemos no llegar a eso!) Del mismo modo, los usuarios y terceros tienen prohibido extraer contenido de la interfaz web o API de la instancia; debe respetar los archivos robots.txt

Revisa la carpeta de Spam si no recibes el email de confirmación.

Imagen de la instancia: Фото Bicanski от Pixnio
Short: Bienvenidos a la instancia más simpática de Mastodon. Somos tuiter.rocks y volamos libres como los pájaros. Instancia generalista. Humor y debate.No tenemos nada que ver con Twitter.com.

Description:
Diese Mastodon-Instanz ist für alle* die LGBT+ oder Allies sind. Ein Safe Space für Dich!

Diese Instanz wird betrieben von Christin Löhner, selbst trans Frau, Vorsitzende der VDGE e.V., Mitglied des Bundesvorstands der Partei mut und Aktivistin für die Rechte aller LSBT+ und Queer Menschen.
Aufgrund der Geschichte mit Elon Musk und Twitter hat sie nun beschlossen, Twitter den Rücken zu kehren und das Mastodon Netzwerk mit einer eigenen Instanz zu unterstützen.

Bei Fragen oder Problemen, einfach @christin direkt anschreiben oder per E-Mail kontaktieren: info@lsbt.me

Keywords: #lsbt #lgbt #lgbtq #lgbttiq #lgbtiq #queer #trans #inter #nonbinary #lgbttiqqapp #safespace

Impressum

Christin Löhner
c/o Block Services
Stuttgarter Str. 106
70736 Fellbach

Bitte keine Pakete oder Päckchen senden - Die Annahme wird verweigert!

tel: +49 7454 999 8104 (NO SUPPORT! Only for judicial purpose!)

Verhaltensregeln

Wir haben für die Nutzung gewisse Serverregeln erstellt, die Ihr etwas weiter unten auf dieser Seite findet und die Ihr mit der Erstellung eines Accounts auf lsbt.me akzeptiert. Bitte beachtet, andere Instanzen haben andere Regeln. Was hier erlaubt ist, kann dort verboten sein und umgekehrt. Wenn Ihr Verstöße erkennt, könnt Ihr diese über das Meldesystem melden. Bitte seid dort so genau wie möglich und gebt uns ggf. Zusatzinformationen, damit wir den Vorfall besser (und schneller) einordnen können. Damit helft Ihr uns. Bei Verstößen gegen die Serverregeln kann es zu einer Löschung der Beiträge und auch zur Löschung des verursachenden Accounts kommen. Bitte beachtet, dass es keine Rückmeldung gibt, was mit Eurer Meldung geschieht.

Server

Der Standort aller benötigten Server für lsbt.me ist in Deutschland.

Serverstatus

Unter der Server und Instanz Status Seite könnt Ihr einsehen, ob die Server derzeit erreichbar sind.

Kosten und Spenden

Aktuell sind für diese Instanz insgesamt drei Server involviert:

  • Instanz Server - Auf diesem läuft die Mastodon Instanz - 16 CPU Cores, 32 GB RAM, 2 TB SSD

  • Backup Server - Hier werden inkrementelle Backups gespeichert. Als Backups stehen jederzeit zur Verfügung: Die letzten 7 Tage, die letzten vier Wochen, die letzten 12 Monate

  • Webseite Server - Hier läuft die leider noch sehr rudimentäre Webseite https://www.lsbt.me

Die Kosten für alle drei Server und die Domains belaufen sich aktuell auf 177,- Euro im Monat, die Christin Löhner vollständig aus eigener Tasche bezahlt.

Du bist sehr, wirklich sehr herzlich eingeladen, Christin dabei ein wenig zu unterstützen. Die Möglichkeiten sind wie folgt:

Paypal:
https://www.paypal.com/paypalme/loehnerchristin

Bankverbindung:
Kontoinhaber: Christin Löhner
IBAN: DE38 5002 4024 2207 0275 01
BIC: DEFFDEFFXXX


Du fragst dich, was Mastodon ist? Besuche joinmastodon.org! Im Wesentlichen ist Mastodon ein dezentrales, quelloffenes soziales Netzwerk.

Description:
ABOUT THIS SERVER

This is a Fediverse/Mastodon instance for climate justice activism groups and other groups who feel they belong to the climatejustice movement and follow our rules and principles as described below.

WHO WE ARE

"We" is currently basically just Paula (@PaulaToThePeople@climatejustice.social), who owns the server.
It is hosted locally in Vienna, Austria via the Fediverse Foundation. The server is NOT officially part of the Fediverse Foundation though.
Paula will try and found a new club to have a legal structure responsible for this server. If you want to join, holler!

DONATIONS

The usage of the server is free and will always remain free, unless something completely unforeseen happens (it won't!).
But the server costs money, which Paula pays out of her own pocket. To support her please donate to:

Name: PaulaToThePeople
IBAN: DE16 4306 0967 8229 4427 00
Bic: GENODEM1GLS

PRINCIPLES

We stand for climate justice, which includes justice for all marginalized people as well as other living beings and we stand against discrimination and exploitation.

We are allies to disabled people, queer and lgbtqia* people, BIPoC, women, poor people, kids and future generations as well as other vulnerable groups including animals, plants and all living beings. We might be critical to religion in general, but stand up against antisemitism, islamomisia and other forms of discrimination due to religious background. We acknowledge our own privileges and work on our own unintentionally discriminatory behaviors. We are all part of an exploitative system and it's impossible to live within that system without harming anyone. We are aware of that and try to work against it, but we are not all fossil free and vegan and that's okay. We don't exclusively post about climate justice, but at least some of our posts should be about climate justice.

We consider ourselves on the left side of the political spectrum and stand up against right wing ideologies.

We have different political views, but are all on the left side or at least are left-open, but right-closed centrists. We stand together against capitalism and fascism and even if we disagree on important issues we don't loose sight of our common goals.

We believe the Fediverse should be a place for respectful discourse and we stand against harassment, trolling and spam.

Everybody's boundaries are to be respected.

We stand up for peace and against violence, oppression and authoritarianism.

We are pacifists, but acknowledge that when attacked, people have the right to defend themselves following international law. We may be critical of states in general, but we never deny any country their statehood. We condemn violence against innocent people and always show solidarity with victims of violence. We don't promote violence in protest, but peaceful sabotage against oppressors is not violence.

We stand behind the science and against fake-news & propaganda.

We are not all scientists ourselves and experts in every field we post about, but we try not to spread any false information. If possible we provide reliable sources. We don't spread unverified rumors.

RULES

  • follow Austrian and EU law
  • don't post pornography

GUIDELINES

Try to always:

  • provide media descriptions
  • use CamelCase in hashtags
  • not overdo it with emojis
  • use content warnings when appropriate
  • hide sensitive media
  • avoid links to privacy violating sites if possible

DISCLAIMER

Principles, rules and guidelines may change at any time and sanctions may be applied according to rules that have not been written yet at that time, but of course never without justification. Appeal is always possible.

MODERATION POLICIES

These are just examples for further clarification. Our principles, rules and guidelines above are what you have to stick to.

What will get you banned immediately:

  • open discrimination
  • right wing ideologies
  • harassment, trolling, spam and porn
  • calls for violence
  • sympathy for oppression
  • pro-authoritarianism
  • spreading of anti-science stances, fake news or propaganda
  • breaking the law drastically or repeatedly

When will we ask you to leave our instance:

  • when you don't align with our principles
  • when you follow our rules, but post almost nothing related to climate justice
  • when you appear more critical of other leftists than the people on the right
  • when we recorded multiple strikes against you
  • when you show a pattern of failing to condemn violence or show unreflected solidarity with a violent, oppressive or authoritarian group of people
  • when you do things that break Austrian law, but are okay somewhere else
  • when even after multiple hints you completely disregard our guidelines

What will get your post deleted and a strike recorded against you:

  • likely unintentional discriminatory behavior or wording
  • likely unintentional behavior that doesn't respect someone else's bondaries
  • likely unintentionally posting something that could lead to violence
  • likely unintentional spreading of false or unverified information
  • when you post something that we fear might get us in trouble with the law

When will we ask you to edit your post and/or consider something for the future:

  • clearly unintentional inconsiderate or unreflective behavior or wording

IMPRINT

Paula Kreuzer
Sillerplatz 8, 1130 Wien
Austria

This is a Fediverse instance for climate justice groups. 
If you're an individual please instead sign up at:
climatejustice.social

Description: Welcome to the teia.art Mastodon server! Teia is a non-profit, community-owned digital arts platform and DAO powered by the energy-efficient Tezos Blockchain. Teia is centered on the #tezos art space, with an emphasis on global inclusivity, diversity, sustainability and equity for artists, collectors and developers.
Short:
Mastodon instance for the global Teia community.
Teia.art is an open source, non-profit digital art marketplace, owned, maintained and developed by its community on the eco-friendly Tezos Blockchain.

Description:
I have created this instance because after being on Mastodon / Fediverse since 2019 I haven't discovered enough gamers to discuss video games with. I have decided to boldly go where no gamer has gone before. My gift to you is a gaming-oriented Mastodon instance where you will find others with mutual interests.

Important message

But in order for this instance to succeed two stars will need to align, and stay aligned.

1. This instance is hosted on masto.host and I need monthly help in funding it. You are welcome to participate for free, but if you like being here please consider funding it monthly if you can. Ko-Fi link is below.

2. As this instance grows, the number of people who have not read the rules will inevitably grow as well, and so will the need for moderation grow. A trustworthy moderator team will be essential. Let me know if you are interested to volunteer for the job and why.

If the above-mentioned stars fail to align in the long run I pledge to you that I will give you a three months notice before shutting down the server so you will have plenty of time to relocate to a different instance.
Read more in the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Donate here to keep the instance running: 💰💰💰 CLICK THIS 💰💰💰 (Ko-fi, PayPal)

Instance supporters

Every instance supporter can get a green verified URL if they are on this list and if they put
https://silversword.online/about/more
in their bio content and label themselves as supporters as I did. Finally, if you wish to be included in this list please send me a direct message.

Supporters:
Test - Darth
- RadleySlayz
- linko
- hellblazer
- OtherRetroMatt
- WMan22
Short: Silversword is a general English-speaking instance for gamers. No matter if you are a Steam gamer, Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo, Amiga, Atari... You get the point :-) Hop on and let's talk video games!

Description:
Welcome to BLÅHAJ Social a Mastodon instance for BLÅHAJ and friends of BLÅHAJ.

What can you use?

We have a Mastodon server with full text search (on local posts) enabled, we offer LibreTranslate on posts in the web interface (data does not leave the network for this feature).

If you wish to follow a birdsite user (just public posts no replies) you can do so by looking for @<username>@birdsite.blahaj.social. Their posts will not show up in the local timeline. Please keep in mind that due to API limitations the capacity is limited so do think twice. Thanks!

How do I support this server?

Currently we can handle all users with some spare capacity on private infrastructure and <$1 in object storage. Should this change check back on this page!

Technical Transparency

We aim to be transparent in how we operate, while we are looking into how to do this properly without too much overhead a list of resources is below:

  • Grafana Public Dashboard
Short: Just a mastodon for people who own at least 1 IKEA BLÅHAJ

Description:
Net4SW is the only NETwork for Adult Content Creators, Fans, Swingers & Fetishists! Like Twitter, but better & Adult friendly, free, descentralised, open-source and based on Mastodon federated networks, dedicated to: adult content creators, sex lovers, fans, sexy influencers, Goddesses & Gods, CamModels, PornStars, fetish stars, promoters, companies, affiliates, webmasters, cam studios, porn studios & porn producers, traffic, payments, designers, freelancers, events organisers, etc...ALL WELCOME! :)

Operated & moderated

We do our best to be as open and tolerant as possible. Anyway, just use common sense and stay between legal limits.

Funds

If you love our network, you can also show your financial support to us. Just contact us for details.

Description:
Bitte sowohl dieses ganze Dokument als auch die Nutzungs- und Datenschutzhinweise lesen, bevor ihr euch einen Account anlegt. / Please read the whole document and the Terms of Service & Data Regulations befor you register for an account. There is also an English version.

An wen richtet sich diese Instanz?

  • Diese Instanz bietet Podcaster*innen einen Platz für ihre Sendungen im Mastodon-Netzwerk. Die Instanz ist ausdrücklich nicht für persönliche Accounts gedacht, sondern nur für solche, die eine einzelne Sendung repräsentieren. Momentan ist die Registrierung geschlossen.
  • Im größten Fall entwickelt sich hier ein Verzeichnis, das einen Überblick über die Podcastwelt im Fediverse bietet. Im kleinsten ist das einfach eine weitere Instanz, auf der die Podcaster*innen, die das möchten, ihre Sendungsaccounts pflegen können.
  • Zumindest vorerst bitte wirklich nur für Podcasts Accounts erstellen, die auch euch gehören!
  • Und: Die Seite ist - im Sinne des Föderalismus - vor allem für die Podcaster*innen gedacht, die aktuell den Betrieb einer eigenen Instanz NICHT leisten können. Große Institutionen und Verlage möchten wir freundlich darauf hinweisen, dass eine eigene Instanz der grundlegenden Idee des Fediverse zuträglicher wäre, als hier einen Account zu eröffnen.
  • Falls ihr ganz neu bei Mastodon seid und euch die Konzepte des Fediverse nicht geläufig sind, gibt es am Ende dieser Seite eine kleine Hilfestellung.

FAQ & Hinweise

Ich möchte hier auch einen Account, geht das?
Man kann die Registrierung ausfüllen und sich damit um einen Account bewerben. Das Moderations-Team schaut sich zeitnah an, ob euer Account alle Bedingungen erfüllt und ob die Instanz gerade ausreichend Ressourcen hat und entscheidet dann darüber.

Falls ihr nicht zugelassen werdet, kann das eine Vielzahl von (technischen, organisatorischen oder inhaltlichen) Gründen haben, bitte seht uns nach, dass wir keine ausführlichen Absagen schreiben. Wir verweisen vorsichtshalber auf Punkt 1 der Nutzungsbedingungen. Hinterlegt in der Bewerbung unbedingt einen Link zu eurem Podcast!

Ihr könnt eurer Sache weiter helfen, in dem ihr in eurer Bewerbung kurz beschreibt, wer ihr seid und was ihr für einen Podcast macht. Falls ihr jemanden kennt, der schon einen Account auf dieser Instanz hat, kann dieser Account gerne eine DM an @cvd schicken und für euch bürgen. Podcasts, die nicht ausschließlich von weißen, alten Männern betrieben werden, werden bevorzugt zugelassen.

Was genau wird von einem Account erwartet?
Vorschrift ist nur, dass euer Account wie euer Podcast heisst. Das heisst bei der Registrierung ist der "Benutzername" der Name eures Podcasts. Als sinnvoll hat sich erwiesen, wenn ihr in eurer Bio nicht nur den Link zu eurer Podcast-Webseite, sondern auch den Link zu dem RSS-Feed eures Podcasts explizit hinterlegt. Für die Bio empfiehlt sich eine Kurzbeschreibung des Podcasts. Juristisch gesehen sollte euer Podcast wahrscheinlich auch ein Link zu einem Impressum enthalten.

Welche Arten von Inhalten erwartet ihr?
Einerseits wollen wir euch das nicht vorschreiben. Andererseits aber ein guter Zeitpunkt in Erinnerung zu rufen, für wen diese Instanz gedacht ist: Für Accounts, die dafür gemacht sind, dass sie von den Hörer*innen eures Podcasts abonniert werden.

Was sind eure offiziellen Kommunikationskanäle?
Wir empfehlen euch den beiden Accounts @cvd (Inhaltliches, Organisatorisches, Moderation) und @engineroom (Infrastruktur, Bugs, Downtimes) zu folgen. Wir empfehlen auch diesen Accounts mit einem Account zu folgen, den ihr regelmäßig lest - das muss nicht unbedingt euer Podcast-Account auf dieser Plattform sein.

Und wie genau bekomme ich jetzt meine Folgen hier in den Account?
Leider gibt es keine uns bekannte gute und komfortable Möglichkeit, das automatisch aus einem RSS-Feed zu befüllen. (Falls ihr eine kennt, sagt uns Bescheid!) Ein erster hilfreicher Schritt ist aber das semiautomatische Tool mastorss von eazy.

Ich habe Folgen-Toots gesehen, die direkt einen Player enthalten, kann ich das auch haben?
Im Prinzip ja, aber wir können da nicht weiterhelfen. Ob der Toot einen Player anzeigt oder nicht, liegt daran auf welcher Plattform ihr euren Podcast hostet. Soweit wir das erkennen können, sind die Toots, die einen Player enthalten alle mit Podlove gehostete Podcasts und haben noch ein extra Social Plugin.

Kann ich einen bestehenden Podcast-Account von einer anderen Instanz hierher umziehen?
Im Prinzip ja, aber das geht nicht komplett. Mastodon erlaubt es einen alten Account auf eine neue Instanz umzuleiten, die Follower*innen dahin zu verschieben und die Folgschaften mitzunehmen. Sämtliche Inhalte gehen aber verloren bzw. verbleiben auf dem alten Account. Wenn das für euch interessant ist, findet ihr hier eine Anleitung. In der Anleitung fehlt, wie man seine Folgschaften per .csv exportiert oder importiert. Falls ihre eine bessere Anleitung kennt, sagt uns gerne Bescheid!

Ich bin Podcast-Hörer*in. Was ist mit mir?
Diese Instanz ist tatsächlich nicht für Hörer*innen-Accounts gedacht, sie ist für Podcast-Accounts gedacht, denen ihr folgen könnt. Die grundlegende Idee ist, dass die Podcaster*innen euch (in ihren Podcasts?) sagen, wo ihr sie findet. Falls ihr nach neuen Podcasts stöbern wollt, könnt ihr hier Accounts entdecken oder hier in aktuellen Posts stöbern.

Warum nehmt ihr denn nicht Castropod oder Funkwhale?
Diese Instanz ist nicht zum förderierten Podcast-Hosting gedacht. Diese Instanz ist für alle gedacht, die ihren Podcast begleitend im Fediverse repräsentieren wollen, ohne ihr bestehendes "normales" Podcast-Setup ändern zu müssen.


Wer pflegt diese Community?

  • Die Initiator*innen sind am Fediverse interessierte Podcaster. Die Moderation übernehmen derzeit Marcus Richter und Ralf Stockmann. Derzeit befindet sich das Angebot in einer geschlossenen Testphase, das Team soll aber - je nachdem wie es läuft - erweitert und diverser werden.
  • Die Software, auf der diese Instanz aufbaut, ist open source und wird auf einem Server in Deutschland betrieben. Die technische Infrastruktur stellt Ralf Rottmann über masto.host.


Regeln / Code of Conduct

"Seid vorzüglich zueinander" ist einfacher gesagt als getan und bedeutet für verschiedene Menschen unterschiedliche Dinge. Die folgenden Regeln sind eine (nicht erschöpfende) Liste von Verhaltensweisen, die nach Ermessen der Instanzadministratoren zum Löschen von Toots oder zum Aussetzen von Konten auf dieser Instanz führen können.

Bitte meldet Verhalten, das Euch stört. Wir werden den Bericht vertraulich behandeln.

  • Wir tolerieren keine Belästigung, Stalking und Doxxing.
  • Wir tolerieren keinen Rassismus, Sexismus, verbalen Missbrauch, Diskriminierung von Geschlecht und sexuellen Minderheiten oder die Unterstützung eines solchen Verhaltens.
  • Wir tolerieren keine gewalttätige nationalistische Propaganda, keine Nazi-Symbolik oder die Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus.
  • Wendet Euch nicht an Accounts, die deutlich gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen. Dazu gehören auch (Anstiftung und Verabredung zur) massenhaften Interaktion oder Hetze gegen solche Accounts. (Dogpiling/Brigading).
  • Beiträge mit nicht jugendfreiem Inhalt müssen markiert werden
  • Werbeanzeigen müssen mit dem Hashtag #werbung gekennzeichnet werden und dürfen nicht übermäßig oder automatisiert sein.
  • Bots dürfen nur dann mit einem Account interagieren, wenn sie von diesem Benutzer dazu aufgefordert werden.
  • Wenn Ihr hier mit hoher Frequenz posten müsst, stellt bitte Eure Beiträge auf nicht gelistet ein, damit die lokale Timeline lesbar bleibt.
  • In Diskussionen bitte höflich bleiben, beleidigt keine Leute, mit denen Ihr schreibt. Setzt Ironie, Sarkasmus oder ähnliche Sprachweisen mit Bedacht ein - sie übersetzen oft nicht gut in die geschriebene Sprache und neigen dazu, Diskussionen oder Missverständnisse zu eskalieren.

Erste Schritte

  • Mastodon lässt sich im Web-Browser sowohl auf dem Desktop als auch mobil gut nutzen. Es gibt aber auch eine Reihe guter Apps, mit denen man beispielsweise Notifications gesendet bekommt. Die bekanntesten sind hier zu finden: https://joinmastodon.org/apps
  • Die grundlegenden Konzepte sind sehr ähnlich zu Twitter. Es gibt aber ein paar markante Unterschiede, die einen zivilisierten Gemeinschaftsdialog fördern sollten. Die Besonderheiten sind hier gut dargestellt: https://blog.joinmastodon.org/2018/07/cage-the-mastodon
  • Eine weitere sehr gute Einführung darüber, was Mastodon ist und wie man am besten einstiegen kann, bietet der Artikel "Mastodon statt Twitter? Was Musk-Flüchtige in dem alternativen Sozialen Medium erwartet".
  • Es ist zugegebenermaßen wahrscheinlich auch so, dass sich diese Instanz nicht als ersten Schritt ins Fediverse anbietet. Die Empfehlung wäre Erfahrungen mit einem (vielleicht temporären?) persönlichen Account zu sammeln und wenn man ein Gefühl für das Fediverse hat, hier einen Account für den eigenen Podcast zu erstellen. Einen guten Leitfaden für einen Einstieg bietet der Artikel "So klappt der Umzug auf Mastodon".

About podcasts.social

Please read the whole document and the Terms of Service & Data Regulations befor you register for an account. / Bitte sowohl dieses ganze Dokument als auch die Nutzungs- und Datenschutzhinweise lesen, bevor ihr euch einen Account anlegt. Es gibt davon auch eine deutsche Version.

Who is this instance for?

  • This instance provides podcasters with a space for their shows on the Mastodon network. The instance is explicitly not intended for personal accounts, only for those representing a single show. Registration is currently closed.
  • If grown to its largest, this will become a directory that provides an overview of the podcast world in the Fediverse. At its smallest, this is simply another instance where podcasters who wish to do so can maintain their show accounts.
  • At least for now, please only create accounts for podcasts that are yours.
  • In the spirit of federalism, this site is primarily intended for podcasters who CANNOT afford to run their own instance. We would like to point out to large institutions and publishers that having their own instance would be more conducive to the idea of the Fediverse.
  • If you are new to Mastodon and not familiar with the concepts of the Fediverse, please refer to the tips at the bottom of this page.

FAQ & Advice

How do I open an account on here?
You can fill in the registration form to apply for an account. The moderation team will check if you meet all requirements and if our instance has enough available resources before making a decision.

A refusal can be due to a variety of reasons, technical, organizational or content-related. Unfortunately, we cannot provide a detailed reasoning. Please also refer to section 1 of the Terms of Use. Be sure to include a link to your podcast in your application!

You can help our decision by briefly describing in your application who you are and what type of podcast you make. In case you know someone who already has an account on this instance, that person can send a DM to @cvd and vouch for you. Podcasts that aren't run exclusively by old white men will be given priority for approval.

What exactly is expected of an account?
The only requirement is that your account is named like your podcast: When you register, the "user name" is the name of your podcast. It is useful to include in your bio: the link to your podcast website, the RSS feed and a short description of the show. You might also want to link to a legal notice providing the publisher's details.

What types of content do you expect?
On the one hand, we don't want to impose anything. On the other hand, this is a good time to remember who this instance is for: show accounts wanting to interact with listeners.

What are your official communication channels?
We recommend you follow these two accounts: @cvd (content, organization, moderation) and @engineroom (infrastructure, bugs, downtime). We recommend you follow these accounts from an account you read regularly (it doesn't have to be your podcast account on this instance).

So how exactly do I get my episodes into an account here?
Unfortunately, we know of no good and convenient way to automatically populate it from an RSS feed. (If you do, let us know!) But a first helpful step is the semi-automatic tool mastorss provided by eazy.

I've seen episode toots that include a player, can I have that too?
Basically yes, but we can't help there. Whether a toot shows a player or not depends on the platform you host your podcast on. As far as we can tell, toots show a player when the podcast is hosted by Podlove and uses an additional social plugin

Can I migrate an existing podcast account from another instance?
Essentially yes, but there are some limitations. Mastodon allows you to redirect an existing account to a new instance maintaining followers and followings. However, all content will remain on the old account. If you are interested in moving, see here for instructions.

I am a podcast listener. Can I get an account, too?
This instance is actually NOT for listener accounts, but for show accounts that you can follow. The basic idea is that podcasters will tell you where to find them, e.g. on their podcast. If you want to browse for new podcasts, you can discover accounts here or see what our podcasters are posting about right now here.

Why don't you use Castropod or Funkwhale?
This instance is NOT meant for federated podcast hosting. This instance is meant for anyone who wants to represent their podcast in the Fediverse in an accompanying way, without having to change their existing podcast setup.


Who maintains this community?

  • The initiators are podcasters interested in the Fediverse. The moderators are Marcus Richter and Ralf Stockmann. The service is currently in a closed testing phase, but the team will be expanded and diversified depending on how things go.
  • This instances is based on open-source software and hosted on a server in Germany. The technical infrastructure is provided by Ralf Rottmann via masto.host.

Rules / Code of Conduct

""Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people. The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviour that may result in the deletion of toots or suspension of accounts on this instance at the discretion of the administrators

Please report behavior that bothers you. We will keep reports confidential.

  • We do not tolerate harassment, stalking, or doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate racism, sexism, verbal abuse, gender and sexual minority discrimination, or the support of such behaviour.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism, or the promotion of Nazi ideology.
  • Do not contact accounts that have made it clear that they do not want to be contacted. This includes (inciting and conspiring to) mass interaction or incitement against such accounts. (Dogpiling/Brigading).
  • Posts with adult content must be flagged.
  • Paid advertisement must be marked with #advertising and not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with an account when prompted by that user.
  • If you post here with high frequency, please set your posts to unlisted to keep the local timeline readable.
  • Please remain polite in discussions, do not insult people you are chatting with. Use irony, sarcasm, or similar language wisely - it often doesn't translate well into written language and tends to escalate discussions or lead to misunderstandings.

First steps

  • Mastodon is easy to use in a web browser on both desktop and mobile. However, there are also a number of good apps that can be used to receive notifications, for example. Some of the most popular ones can be found here.
  • The basic concepts of Mastodon are very similar to Twitter. However, there are a few striking differences that ought to encourage a civilized community discourse. The specifics are well laid out here.
  • Another very good introduction to what Mastodon is and how best to get started is ["A futuristic Mastodon introduction for 2021".
  • Admittedly, this instance might not be a good first step into the Fediverse. It's recommended that you gain experience with a (perhaps temporary?) personal account, and once you have a feel for the Fediverse, create an account for your own podcast here. A good guide for getting started can be found on Fedi.Tips.
Short: podcasts.social - Mastodon für Podcasts

Description:
Respektiert euch gegenseitig!

Du kennst dich mit Regeln aus, deshalb halte dich bitte auch abseits des Spieltischs hier daran. Die Regeln, die wir als ganz normale Umgangsformen ansehen, werden durch die Spielleitung (Moderatoren) festgelegt und im Zweifelsfall auch durch sie klargestellt.

Die Spielleitung behält sich das Recht vor, Toots zu löschen oder einen Account zu blockieren, wenn gegen die Regeln verstoßen werden sollte.

Denk daran, dass du, wie in einem Mehrpersonenspiel, mit echten Menschen interagierst. Diese können andere Gefühle, Meinungen, Hintergründe und Erfahrungen haben als du. Du musst nicht mit jemandem, der gleichen Meinung sein, um höflich zu sein.

Diskussionen beleben das Miteinander - wie könnten wir sonst sinnvoll Werwölfe spielen? Wenn du allerdings nicht zivilisiert mit jemandem umgehen kannst, lass ihn in Frieden. Bedenke dabei auch: Dinge, die für dich normal sind, können für eine:n andere:n verletzend sein.

Machen dich Beiträge von jemandem wütend? Ärgerst du dich über eine Aussage einer anderen Nutzer:in? Antworte nicht sofort. Nimm dir Zeit, um dich zu beruhigen. Möchtest du immer noch antworten? Dann tu es jetzt.

Spiel nicht Monopoly.

Ansprechpartner

Du hast Fragen oder Probleme? Melde dich ganz einfach bei der Spielleitung oder den Erklbär:innen:

  • @RodNoc (Admin)
  • @azrael2k (Admin)

Rechtliches

Zum Impressum und der Datenschutzerklärung geht es hier entlang

Unterstützung

Dieser Server ist für jeden kostenlos nutzbar, es wird kein "Eintritt" genommen oder Werbung geschaltet. Da aber immer wieder geäußert wurde, dass man sich gerne an den Kosten beteiligen möchte, habe ich einen Ko-Fi Account angelegt. Ich weise aber nochmals darauf hin, dass die Nutzung wirklich kostenfrei ist und sich keiner verpflichtet fühlen soll. Hier geht es zum Sparschwein
Short: Von Brettspielern für Brettspieler.
