Description:
Welcome to hoosier.social! This Mastodon server aims to support the interests and communication of Indiana residents. With respect to Hoosier Hospitality, we encourage civil discourse between our members and want to create a space that is open & accepting to all.

Welcome Guide - Kit Malone (Chief Ambassador to Hoosier Social, @thekitmalone@hoosier.social) assembled a great introduction to Mastodon, the Fediverse, and our community here. It should be helpful for some of the most common initial FAQs, but please let us know if you have any questions or we can help improve your experience!

We subscribe to the goals defined in the Mastodon Server Covenant.

We regularly update our federation blocklist with the Unified Tier 0 file, which is further explained on the Oliphant site. Please see the "Moderated servers" on this About page.

This server is privately funded. We are not accepting donations at this time, but hope to grow to a point where this will be welcomed in the future.

DMCA policy

This Digital Millennium Copyright Act policy (“Policy”) applies to the hoosier.social website (“Website” or “Service”) and any of its related products and services (collectively, “Services”) and outlines how this Website operator (“Operator”, “we”, “us” or “our”) addresses copyright infringement notifications and how you (“you” or “your”) may submit a copyright infringement complaint.

Protection of intellectual property is important to us and we ask our users and their authorized agents to do the same. It is our policy to respond to clear notifications of alleged copyright infringement that comply with the United States Digital Millennium Copyright Act (“DMCA”) of 1998, the text of which can be found at the U.S. Copyright Office website. This DMCA policy was created with the help of WebsitePolicies.

Table of contents

  1. What to consider before submitting a copyright complaint
  2. Notifications of infringement
  3. Counter-notifications
  4. Changes and amendments
  5. Reporting copyright infringement

What to consider before submitting a copyright complaint

Before submitting a copyright complaint to us, consider whether the use could be considered fair use. Fair use states that brief excerpts of copyrighted material may, under certain circumstances, be quoted verbatim for purposes such as criticism, news reporting, teaching, and research, without the need for permission from or payment to the copyright holder. If you have considered fair use, and you still wish to continue with a copyright complaint, you may want to first reach out to the user in question to see if you can resolve the matter directly with the user.

Please note that if you are unsure whether the material you are reporting is in fact infringing, you may wish to contact an attorney before filing a notification with us.

We may, at our discretion or as required by law, share a copy of your notification or counter-notification with third parties. This may include sharing the information with the account holder engaged in the allegedly infringing activity or for publication. If you are concerned about your information being forwarded, you may wish to hire an agent to report infringing material for you.

Notifications of infringement

If you are a copyright owner or an agent thereof, and you believe that any material available on our Services infringes your copyrights, then you may submit a written copyright infringement notification (“Notification”) using the contact details below pursuant to the DMCA. All such Notifications must comply with the DMCA requirements. You may refer to a DMCA takedown notice generator or other similar services to avoid making mistake and ensure compliance of your Notification.

Filing a DMCA complaint is the start of a pre-defined legal process. Your complaint will be reviewed for accuracy, validity, and completeness. If your complaint has satisfied these requirements, our response may include the removal or restriction of access to allegedly infringing material as well as a permanent termination of repeat infringers’ accounts.

If we remove or restrict access to materials or terminate an account in response to a Notification of alleged infringement, we will make a good faith effort to contact the affected user with information concerning the removal or restriction of access, which may include a full copy of your Notification (including your name, address, phone, and email address), along with instructions for filing a counter-notification.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any portion of this Policy, the Operator reserves the right to take no action upon receipt of a DMCA copyright infringement notification if it fails to comply with all the requirements of the DMCA for such notifications.

Counter-notifications

A user who receives a copyright infringement Notification may make a counter-Notification pursuant to sections 512(g)(2) and (3) of the US Copyright Act. If you receive a copyright infringement Notification, it means that the material described in the Notification has been removed from our Services or access to the material has been restricted. Please take the time to read through the Notification, which includes information on the Notification we received. To file a counter-notification with us, you must provide a written communication compliant with the DMCA requirements.

Please note that if you are not sure whether certain material infringes the copyrights of others or that the material or activity was removed or restricted by mistake or misidentification, you may wish to contact an attorney before filing a counter-notification.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any portion of this Policy, the Operator reserves the right to take no action upon receipt of a counter-notification. If we receive a counter-notification that complies with the terms of 17 U.S.C. § 512(g), we may forward it to the person who filed the original Notification.

Changes and amendments

We reserve the right to modify this Policy or its terms related to the Website and Services at any time at our discretion. When we do, we will revise the updated date at the bottom of this page. We may also provide notice to you in other ways at our discretion, such as through the contact information you have provided.

An updated version of this Policy will be effective immediately upon the posting of the revised Policy unless otherwise specified. Your continued use of the Website and Services after the effective date of the revised Policy (or such other act specified at that time) will constitute your consent to those changes.

Reporting copyright infringement

If you would like to notify us of the infringing material or activity, we encourage you to contact us using the details below:

hoosiersocial@hoosier.social

This document was last updated on December 30, 2022

hoosier.social is owned and operated by Hoosier Social Mastodon LLC.

Admins will de-federate any servers whose users act as a group to harass or attack this server or our users.', "Users should not assume privacy on this server or anywhere on Mastodon. It's not designed to be private. Assume that anything you post here, including direct messages, are publicly visible.", 'These rules can be changed or updated at any time by Hoosier.Social Admins. ', 'By joining Hoosier.Social you agree to these rules.']

Description:
Welcome to a server dedicated to gainers, encouragers and all the other members of this community. This is still an experimental version and an exploration journey for you and us alike.

We are hoping to establish a community that is only moderated by its members and does not answer to rules of apple store or Instagram censorship. Your data is saved on this server and we can guarantee its persistence only as far as the server is up.

See our service status for both gainer.cloud and about.gainer.cloud Status Page

If you need any support that does not relate to moderation of the site, such as login issues, please use our helpdesk Support.Gainer.Cloud

Make sure you back up any content you post here. Similarly to Twitter, you can make your profile private by going to Preferences>Other>Posting privacy and setting Followers only.

Please be respectful and kind and most importantly have fun!

Mods: @AdamSorrel @Waleslad1994

Please note all emails come from the domain @gainer.cloud

Please make sure you check the SPAM folder in your emails when signing up, our emails may end up there, for future reference please add Mastodon@Gainer.Cloud to your safe sender list.

We may email you to further confirm your request if we cannot do so from your registration request, this email will come from Support@Gainer.Cloud

This instance will always remain free to use and ad free, no tiers like premium access thats the mastodon way and we dont believe that you should pay for more access, everyone is equal :) If you feel like you could support the instance all donations go to the running, maintence and upgrades of the instance :)

Ko-Fi
Short: Welcome to a server dedicated to gainers, encouragers and all the other members of this community. This is still an experimental version and an exploration journey for you and us alike.

Description:
Wilkommen auf der Mastodon Instanz der AcademicCloud, bereitgestellt durch die Gesellschaft für wissenschaftliche Datenverarbeitung mbH Göttingen (kurz: GWDG). Es gelten die jeweiligen Nutzungsbedingungen und Datenschutzhinweise.

Themenschwerpunkt und Zielgruppe

Diese Instanz ist Teil der AcademicCloud und steht Universitäten, Hochschul- oder Forschungseinrichtung in Niedersachsen, allen Instituten der Max-Planck-Gesellschaft sowie weiteren Partner im AcademicCloud Verbund zur freien Verfügung. Wir wollen hier eine Plattform für akademische Themen rund um Wissenschaft, Forschung und Lehre schaffen und den Austausch zwischen Disziplinen und Institutionen fördern.

Registrierung

Für die Nutzung dieser Instanz ist eine AcademicID erforderlich. Wenn Sie einem Institut oder einer Hochschule im AcademicCloud Verbund angehören, haben Sie bereits eine und können sofort los legen.

Für die öffentliche Repräsentation besonderer Projekte oder ganzer Institutionen sind natürlich auch spezielle Profile mit Wunschnamen möglich. Wenden Sie sich hierfür bitte an support@gwdg.de.

Freie Registrierung ohne AcademicID ist zur Zeit leider nicht möglich. Wenn Sie mit Profilen dieser Instanz interagieren möchten, können Sie jedoch auch eine der zahlreichen offenen Instanzen des Mastodon-Netzwerkes nutzen. Ein Account auf genau dieser Instanz ist dafür nicht notwendig.

Übrigens, sollte ihre AcademicID wechseln oder auslaufen, zum Beispiel weil Sie ihre bisherige Hochschule oder Institution verlassen, haben wir mehrere Möglichkeiten: Sie können ihr Profil entweder selbstständig auf eine andere Instanz umziehen, oder ihr Profil von uns auf eine neue AcademicID (auch privat registriert) übertragen lassen und einfach weiter nutzen. Ihre Kontakte gehen also nicht verloren. Auf keinen Fall werden Profile ohne Rücksprache oder angemessene Frist von uns gelöscht.

Nutzungsbedingungen

Neben der Einhaltung allgemeiner Nutzungsbedingungen sowie gesetzlicher Vorschriften erwarten wir von unseren Nutzer*innen einen respektvollen und konstruktiven Umgang auf dieser Plattform. Bitte verzichten Sie auf vulgäre, beleidigende oder diskriminierende Beiträge und beachten Sie insbesondere die Serverregeln weiter unten. Wir behalten uns vor, problematische Beiträge gegebenenfalls auch ohne Angabe von Gründen zu verbergen oder zu löschen und Profile einzuschränken, sollte dies nötig werden.

Impressum

Diese Webseite wird betrieben von der Gesellschaft für wissenschaftliche Datenverarbeitung mbH Göttingen (kurz: GWDG).

Anschrift: Gesellschaft für wissenschaftliche Datenverarbeitung mbH Göttingen Burckhardtweg 4 37077 Göttingen

Telefon: +49 551 39-30001 Kontakt: support@gwdg.de

Die Gesellschaft für wissenschaftliche Datenverarbeitung mbH Göttingen (GWDG) ist beim Amtsgericht Göttingen in das Handelsregister unter der Nr. B 598 als gemeinnützige GmbH eingetragen. Sitz der Gesellschaft ist Göttingen. Gesetzlich vertreten wird sie durch den Geschäftsführer Prof. Dr. Ramin Yahyapour. Vorsitzender des Aufsichtsrats ist Prof. Dr. Christian Griesinger. Die Umsatzsteueridentifikationsnummer der GWDG lautet DE-115312930.

Inhalte auf dieser Webseite werden vorrangig durch die Nutzer*innen erstellt und ohne vorherige Prüfung durch den Betreiber verarbeitet und gegebenenfalls veröffentlicht. Die GWDG macht sich diese durch Nutzer*innen erstellten Inhalte ausdrücklich nicht zu eigen. Sollte die GWDG feststellen oder von Anderen darauf hingewiesen werden, dass bestimmte Inhalte eine zivil- oder strafrechtliche Verantwortlichkeit auslösen, werden diese Inhalte nach bestem Wissen und Gewissen unverzüglich korrigiert oder entfernt.

Datenschutz

Information zum Datenschutz finden Sie hier.

Description:
A quick note on Financial Sustainability

Please help support running of this instance through the various options available on our website https://linux.chat/donate/. Our options start as low as $2.

For Patreon subscriptions we offer a supporter badge!

Linux.Social

Linux.social was launched on 25 December 2022 as a Mastodon instance for people who are passionate about, support, or work with Linux®. Our community discussions aren't limited to just Linux®-related topics, but we do require a reasonable ratio of content to be on-topic.

Posting in English is recommended for maximum conversation opportunities within the community. You will need to understand English in order to agree to our Community Code of Conduct.

This service was installed and is maintained by Linux.Chat with equipment, hosting and object storage sponsored by Conarx, Ltd located at OVH.

Please contact @admin@linux.social or email us on admin@Linux.social with any moderation or administrative concerns. Additional information about reporting concerns related to the Community Code of Conduct can be found below.

For media and press-related topics please use contact@Linux.social.

How to Thrive on Linux.social

  • Browse the Local Timeline and get to know others in our community.
  • Search and follow hashtags for topics that interest you, and follow interesting people.
  • Add respectful replies and conversation to others' posts you find interesting.
  • Set up Filters for types of content you don't want to see, and use CW (content warning) and hashtags to help people filter what you may send.
  • Report content that you find concerning, whether it's from Linux.social people or other servers.
  • We like politics and religion, however, we find these topics tend to cause unnecessary friction and prefer to avoid them in our community.
  • We're all here because we want a fun, friendly, safe and enjoyable place to communicate, share and collaborate free of the toxicity encountered on other platforms on topics related to Linux®.
  • We encourage everyone to steer discussions in a productive direction. For more details, review our Catalyst Guidelines

Linux.social Community Code of Conduct

Our Pledge to Each Other

In the interest of fostering an open, positive, fun, friendly and welcoming environment, we as Linux.social members, moderators, and admins (collectively known as Linux.social community members) pledge to make our participation in the Linux.Chat group of communities and the greater Fediverse a pleasant and harassment-free experience for everyone.

Diversity is Encouraged

Linux.Chat aims to provide a positive, safe environment not only everyone in its communities but also those who interact with us, regardless of:

  • age;
  • body size;
  • caste;
  • disability;
  • ethnicity;
  • gender identity and expression;
  • level of experience;
  • education;
  • socio-economic status;
  • nationality;
  • personal appearance;
  • race;
  • religion (or lack thereof);
  • sexual identity and orientation;
  • tribe; or
  • other protected status as defined by laws or the Universal Declaration of Human Rights

Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating an open, positive, fun, friendly and welcoming environment include, but are not limited to:

  • Using welcoming, inclusive and friendly language.
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences.
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism and respectively giving it.
  • Focusing on what is best for the community.
  • Showing empathy towards other community members.

Examples of unacceptable behavior by Linux.Chat community members include, but are not limited to:

  • Insulting/derogatory comments.
  • Trolling.
  • Statements or jokes that exclude based on the demographic groups in the above "Diversity is Encouraged" section.
  • Deliberate intimidation, stalking, or following.
  • Public or private harassment.
  • Publishing others’ private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission.
  • Sexual language, imagery, attention, or advances towards others, or behavior that contributes to a sexualized environment.
  • Violence directed against another person, including violent threats and violent language.
  • Uploading images, audio, or video with Public visibility (appears on Local or Federated timelines) without adding ALT text media descriptions.
  • Expressing support for such unacceptable behaviors by others.

Linux.social prioritizes marginalized people's safety over privileged people's comfort. Linux.social moderators and admins will not take action on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia".
  • The tone or writing style used when responding to harassment, racism, sexism, transphobia, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions.
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you".

Our Responsibilities

Linux.social moderators and admins are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Linux.social moderators and admins have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject posts, messages, comments, commits, code, or any other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct.

Linux.social moderators and admins have the right to take certain action in response to any Linux.social community member exhibiting other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful or causes damage to the reputation of the Linux.social community or Linux.Chat group of communities.

Examples of such actions include, but are not limited to:

  • Removal or limiting viewability of content posted to Linux.social.
  • A temporary, permanent or global ban from all Linux.Chat communities.
  • A temporary, permanent or global ban from applying for a Linux.social account in the future or global ban across the Linux.Chat group of communities.
  • A temporary, permanent or global ban from participating as a Linux.social moderator or admin or global ban across the Linux.Chat group of communities.

Scope

This Code of Conduct applies to all Linux.Chat community spaces, including Linux.social and Linux.community, herein collectively referred to as Linux.Chat:

  • The Linux.Chat and Linux.Chat-related websites.
  • The Linux.Chat public and private mailing lists.
  • Any official public or private Linux.Chat forums or rooms on Matrix, IRC and Discord.
  • Any Linux.Chat public and private git repositories.
  • Any additional Linux.Chat project spaces or communities added in the future.

When Linux.Chat community members contribute in discussion in or from our services, they represent the Linux.Chat community and its reputation.

Therefore, this Code of Conduct applies to:

  • Public communication between Linux.Chat community members in community spaces of Linux®-related, free software projects or non-profits who are also Linux®-related community members.
  • Public communication between Linux.Chat community members at gatherings related to Linux.Chat and at Linux®-related events generally.
  • Public Linux.Chat social media posts and comments by Linux.Chat community members on those social media posts.
  • Private communication between Linux.Chat community members related to Linux.Chat communities or its members.
  • Private communication between Linux.Chat community members and Linux.Chat admins or moderators.

This Code of Conduct also applies to official Linux.Chat communication, such as:

  • Using an official Linux.Chat e-mail address.
  • Acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event.
  • Posting via an official Linux.Chat social media account.

Representation of our community may be further defined and clarified by Linux.Chat admins and moderators.

If a concern about a past incident in any space is made known to a moderator or admin about a current Linux.Chat community member, Linux.Chat moderators or admins may take it into account when deciding whether the incident should have any consequences to the community member's participation in the Linux.Chat community.

Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by:

  • Using the "Report" menu item on any post or profile in the Mastodon software (preferred).
  • Contacting Linux.Chat admins directly through the @admin@Linux.social account.
  • Contacting Linux.Chat admins or moderator privately through their official Linux.Chat community account.
  • Sending an email to abuse@Linux.Chat.

All complaints will be reviewed and investigated as quickly as possible, and will result in a response that is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The Linux.Chat admins and moderators are obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident. Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the FLOSS.social Code of Conduct as of December 21, 2022 and the Outreachy Community Code of Conduct as of January 28, 2002, made available under the terms of the GNU General Public License, version 3, and this "Linux.Chat Community Code of Conduct" is published under those same terms. The Outreachy Community Code of Conduct was adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4.

DMCA Takedown Notices

DMCA takedown notices may be submitted to dmca@Linux.social.

Please ensure your DMCA takedown notice meets the following requirements:

  • The signature of the copyright owner or owner’s agent, in electronic form.
  • Identification of the: (i) copyrighted work(s) infringed; (ii) the infringing activity; and (iii) the location of the infringing activity (by providing the URL).
  • Contact information of the notice sender, including an email address.
  • A statement that the notifier has a good faith belief that the material is not authorized by the intellectual property or copyright owner, its agent, or the law.
  • A statement that the information provided is accurate and the notifier is authorized to make the complaint on behalf of the intellectual property or copyright owner.

Please also take note of the DMCA takedown procedure:

  • A copyright holder files a takedown notice, under penalty of perjury, with Linux.social claiming that the site is hosting infringing content owned by the copyright holder;
  • Linux.social will provide the posting party (24) hours to remove the content, should they fail to action this, we will remove the content within (24) hours;
  • The posting party then has the right to file a counter-notification, informing Linux.social that the content is not infringing; and
  • If a counter-notice is filed, the service provider must re-host the content unless the original copyright holder files a lawsuit.

Linux.social Inactive Account Policy

In an effort to free up a wide range of account names, we may delete inactive accounts and associated personal data.

An account is considered inactive when:

  • no posts have been made on the account and it has been at least twelve (12) months since the account was last accessed; or
  • it has been at least twenty-four (24) months since the account was last accessed

For purposes of this policy, "accessed" means you have interacted with your account through one or more signed-in session from any device.

In order to warn the users concerned, an email will be sent to the e-mail address on file for the account providing the user twenty-one (28) days to reply and request an appeal for the account to be restored. Once an account has been deleted and the warning period has passed, it can no longer be recovered. To use Linux.social again, you'll need to create a new account.

Server Policies and Information

Our server policies and information can be contributed to via our GitLab instance repository.
Short: Official Mastodon for the Linux.Chat multi-platform community, for people who are passionate about, support, or work with Linux. See https://Linux.Chat for more info.

Description:
Välkommen til Spejset!

Spejset är en instans där folk ska trivas och känna sig hemma på. Den driftas av den ideella Kamratdataföreningen Konstellationen som vilar på en demokratisk, socialistisk, feministisk och antirasistisk grund. Det är Konstellationen som tillhanda- och underhåller instansen samt som sätter upp och fattar beslut om frågor som rör Spejset, t.ex. gällande serverregler och blocklistor. Du kan därför förvänta dig att återfinna föreningens värderingar här.

Det finns inget krav på att bli medlem i Konstellationen för att skapa konto på Spejset men det är genom medlemskap som man kan vara med och påverka demokratiskt kring beslut om Spejset (och andra projekt som Konstellationen driver).

Ny som Mastodonanvändare?

Om du är ny som användare på Mastodon kan vi rekommendera följande läsning:

  • Kom igång med Mastodon (från Konstellationens wiki)
  • Hitta folk att följa (från Konstellationens wiki)
  • mastodon.help
  • fedi.tips
Short: Spejset är en instans för folk i Sverige som definierar sig som vänster

Description:
Welcome!

This Mastodon instance was created in December 2022 for /r/neoliberal as part of the broader neoliber.al domain as a reward for reaching a milestone during our charity drive. While primarily a spinoff of the subreddit, we welcome new accounts from anyone who is looking for a community based on liberal values

New to Mastodon? You can learn more about it here. In short, this is an independently-run social media website that can communicate with other such websites using the ActivityPub protocol. If you create an account here, you can follow and chat with people on any other Mastodon instance and even on other social media platforms such as Lemmy and Pixelfed. This network is known as the "Fediverse" and is home to over 1.5 million monthly active users

mastodon.social is the most popular instance, so why make an account here? First, it gives you access to our local community feed of people who have also decided to create an account here (100% good takes guaranteed or your money back). Second, as a small community, you can get direct support from the admins and a say in how moderation is handled. And lastly, thanks in part to the software Chuckya and glitch-soc, we have some extra features here not found on other Mastodon instances including:

  • Gigachad Obama emoji
  • Markdown formatting
  • Local-only posts
  • Doodle posts
  • Emoji reactions
  • Tenor GIF selector
  • Optional Mastodon Modern Theme (source)

Some Mastodon apps will not support all these features, but the website always works

Moderation

This instance is actively moderated and reports are usually responded to within 12 hours. We do not allow racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, or bad stuff in general

As a user, Mastodon has powerful tools for deciding what content you want to see, including word filters, blocking accounts, and blocking entire instances. As such, our current policy is to only perform site-wide blocks of other instances for spam, harassment, hate speech, and illegal or otherwise highly-objectionable content. Please reach out if you think a server has been wrongfully blocked

In the future it may be possible to communicate with Bluesky and Threads. Some instances intend to block communication with these services because they're for-profit corporate entities, but we don't have any plans to do so

Privacy

We use the default Mastodon privacy policy. Please do not make an account here if you are under 13 or if handling your information as described in the privacy policy is otherwise illegal

It is not required to sign in to see posts made on this server. Therefore, blocking someone prevents them from replying to you, but does not stop them from reading your posts. This also means that posts made here can show up in search engine results or be archived by third parties (eg. Internet Archive's Wayback Machine). This is the same as how Reddit operates. If you're looking for more privacy, you'll want to find a Mastodon instance that supports what's known as "authorized fetch"

Administration

A minimum of 90 days notice will be given if this instance is going to shut down, and backups are automatically performed daily. That said, we are not fully compliant with the Mastodon Server Covenant due to only one person having access to the server infrastructure

Server hosting and services are provided by Digital Ocean and Amazon AWS. Monthly costs are approximately $40. We are not accepting donations at this time, but if you would like to support the growth of Mastodon as a whole, consider contributing to the Mastodon gGmbH Patreon or another small instance

This instance is not affiliated with the Mastodon gGmbH nonprofit corporation. Accordingly, please direct all issues regarding the content on or moderation of this instance (eg. DMCA, GDPR, ban appeals, server blocks, tech support) to jenbanim@gmail.com
Short: An instance for reddit.com/r/neoliberal

Description:
bzh.social

est un réseau social pour les personnes qui vivent en Bretagne ou qui s'intéressent à la culture bretonne.

Responsabilité des contenus publiés sur internet : quelles sont les règles ?

En tant que citoyen nous avons des droits et des devoirs, même sur internet, même en Bretagne.

Selon la loi française les infractions suivantes, lorsqu'elles sont commises sur internet, seront punis si commis :

  • Apologie de crimes contre l'humanité
  • Négation ou minimisation de crimes contre l'humanité
  • Apologie du terrorisme
  • Incitation à la haine raciale
  • Diffusion d'images violentes ou pédophiles
  • Incitation à la violence
  • Incitation à la violence sexuelle et ou sexiste
  • Atteintes à la dignité humaine
  • Harcèlement
  • Injures raciales
  • Injures sexistes
  • Diffamation
  • Atteintes au droit à l'image et à la vie privée

Merci de signaler tout contenu non légal en France.

Pour plus d'informations: 🔗https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F32075

Victime d'une publication malveillante sur internet ?

L'internet étant un endroit où la pseudonymisation est facile, certaines personnes malveillantes se permettent des choses qu'elles ne feraient pas si elles étaient identifiables.

Le harcèlement sur internet est consideré comme un délit selon la loi française et est donc punis plus sévèrement que certaines infractions.

Si vous êtes victime de cyberharcèlement, s'il vous plaît, ne vous laissez pas faire et consultez vos droits:

Pour plus d'informations: 🔗https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F32239

Usurpation d’identité, comment s’en protéger ?

L’usurpation d’identité est un délit pénal.

Si vous constatez une usurpation d'identité, collectez tous les éléments prouvant l’infraction (captures d’écrans, URL des pages concernées, justificatifs etc.). Vous pourrez ensuite vous tourner vers le ou les sites sur lesquels l’usurpation d’identité a eu lieu et leur demander d’intervenir pour la suppression des informations vous concernant.

Vous êtes par ailleurs en droit de déposer une plainte pénale auprès d’un commissariat de police, d’une gendarmerie ou du procureur de la République.

Pour plus d'informations: 🔗https://www.economie.gouv.fr/particuliers/protection-usurpation-identite

Contrat de Serveur Mastodon

Nous respectons le Contrat de Serveur Mastodon et nous engageons de lutter activement contre le racisme, le sexisme, la homophobie ainsi que la transphobie.

Nous faisons des sauvegardes régulières des données de notre serveur, tous les jours.

Nous nous engageons également de notifier nos utilisateurs avec un préavis de au moins 3 mois, avant de fermer ce serveur, si jamais nous en sommes contraint de le faire.

Code Source

Pour gérer le serveur nous utilisons une approche qui s'appelle "Infrastructure as Code" (IaC). Ça veut dire que toute notre infrastructure est configurée en utilisant du code et aucune étape manuelle (enfin presque) n'est nécessaire afin de configurer ou mettre à jour le serveur.

En tout cas si ça vous intéresse, voici tout le code source qui alimente bzh.social : https://github.com/bzh-social/bzh-systems

Attribution

  • :gwennhadu: "Creative Commons Gwenn ha Du (11 mouchetures)" by GwenOfGwened is licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0
  • :triskel: "Triskele-Symbol-spiral-five-thirds-turns" by AnonMoos, marked as public domain, more details on Wikimedia Commons
  • :triskeld: "Triskele-Symbol1" by AnonMoos, marked as public domain, more details on Wikimedia Commons
  • :breizh: Rimex-FrancelocationBrittany.svg: Gwennhadu.svg: derivative work: Fry1989 (talk) 22:58, 20 March 2011 (UTC), Flag map of Brittany (Bretagne), CC BY-SA 3.0
  • :hermine: Drapeau de la province de Bretagne en 1532 (Hermine plain): derivate work: bzh.social, Hermine, CC BY-SA 4.0
Short: "Chez les Bretons, il ne pleut que sur les cons" 🌦️ Ceci est un serveur pour les personnes qui vivent en Bretagne ou qui s'intéressent à la culture bretonne.

Description:
library.love is a mastodon instance for library workers and library lovers! Run by Califa, a California nonprofit library consortium, we champion a world where everyone is equal, included and thriving through libraries!

Equity, diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our commitment to eliminating systemic racism and barriers to access. We affirm the rights of the LGBTQIA community and support efforts to combat all forms of oppression! Join us. Join the conversation. Be thoughtful. And always, be kind!
Short: library.love is a mastodon instance for library workers and library lovers! Run by Califa Group (califa.org), a nonprofit library consortium in San Francisco, CA, USA.

Description:
希奇！是一个轻松的创作者乐园。我们相信任何从无到有的过程都是创作，不论是一条嘟文还是一幅作品。我们愿为任何形式的创作提供支持，分享您创作过程中的欣喜。这里没有复杂的算法和规则，愿每个人都在希奇！找到属于『自己』的初心。

本站特色

  • 本站是一个 Mastodon | 长毛象 的中文实例，接入去中心化的联邦宇宙(Fediverse)。在联邦宇宙里每个实例既互联互通，又不受一个单一实体控制。
  • 站点附属希奇！博客栈，为每一位用户开放。这是一个在发嘟之余写长文的地方。
  • 站内用户可以拥有一个 @c7.io 的收信地址。
  • 本站开启了 Elasticsearch 嘟文全文搜索并对中文检索优化。
  • 不删除外站的嘟文和媒体文件，不会发生外站嘟文莫名消失、看不到跨站嘟友的媒体文件等问题。
  • 拥有商业化站点的基础架构和运维经验，独立非商业的社区运营。
  • 公布了#运营白皮书，每次发布白皮书会承诺继续运营一年。白皮书每半年发布一次。

使用指南 / 常见问题

如果对站点使用有任何疑问，请点击 #站点说明 或点击上方管理员猫猫私信询问。

也请参阅 Mastodon官方指南。

支持希奇！

本站接受服务器托管费用捐款。捐赠可获得神秘福利。

社区规则

社区规则都在下面明确列出，违反者将会被封禁。没有被规则禁止的行为则不受任何限制，请在 希奇！享受表达的愉悦而不是“我能不能说”的担忧。
Short: 希奇！是一个轻松的创作者乐园。愿每个人都在这里找到属于『自己』的初心。

Description:
Welcome to procursus.social!

We run a general Mastodon instance for Procursus, contributors, and other software development adjacent folks.

What’s special about this instance?

The Procursus Mastodon instance has a focus on reliability and speed, as well as continued and constant support. We are a smaller instance, but we are scaled to reliably support thousands of users, and terabytes of media. We will NEVER delete cached posts, and we only removed cached media after a full year (it will be re-cached if needed). We have also made some changes to Mastodon specific to our server, such as increasing toot size to 5k characters! We are going to continue making this server as great as possible for the amazing developers and users here, with stellar, immediate support.

For the safety of users on our instance, we regularly import the latest FediNuke and Garden Fence instance blocklists. Other instances may also be blocked at our discretion should we find that they encourage offensive content.

Want to join?

procursus.social is a smaller instance, and we try to keep it clean! If you'd like to join, we'd love to have you. Just sign up, and make sure you put something in the "reason" related to your interests, so we can make sure you'll be a great fit for our instance!
Short: A general instance for Procursus, contributors, and other software development adjacent folks.

Description:
Whether it's those intense couch battles playing Mario Kart, chilled sessions with Stardew Valley or franticly building barricades in Fortnite, Gamepad.Club is for you. However you play, this place is a home for everything gaming. Join us and chat about the latest releases, what you’re currently playing, and what upcoming launches you’re hyped for!

Don't worry about staying on topic though. Create an account, share your interests in an introductory post, and enjoy being part of a growing community on a network of connected Mastodon instances around the globe!

Signing up for an account is free, although there are some ground rules that you'll see below. So that we can tell you're a human and not some basic bot, please include a reason for joining. Once checked and manually approved, you'll get an email inviting you to get started!

How Gamepad.Club is Run

To support our growing and active community, this server is moderated by a team of volunteers. It currently consists of the following, who are all on-hand to respond to your queries:

  • Gazimoff (owner, admin)
  • Belghast (co-admin)
  • Aywren (mod)
  • Scopique (mod)

This instance of Mastodon is powered by Linode cloud computing using industrial-grade data centres and infrastructure. Backups are taken daily and rotated to ensure that data is protected.

We also adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant, including providing at least 3 months notice should the server regrettably plan to shut down. This will provide ample opportunity if you want to download your content and/or move to another instance.

While we're on the topic, please remember that anything you publish on Gamepad.Club (your posts and images) is stored unencrypted. This includes Direct Messages and other closed/locked posts. Please do not use this service to share anything confidential or personal that you cannot risk becoming public.

Gamepad.Club is currently funded out-of-pocket by the admin team, with support from incredibly generous members via Patreon. Advance notice will be shared if that needs to change, but members will never be charged for access, adverts will never be used, trackers will never be deployed and data will never be sold to third-parties.
Short: Gamepad.Club has a video games focus, but we're open to all forms of gaming from tabletop RPGs to trading card games. Hosted in the UK and EU but everyone is welcome!

Description:
本站，Hydrate Craft，致力于成为 Mastodon 中文社区的大型交流站点。

我们鼓励以下内容： 计算机技术，学科知识交流；艺术创作交流；MC等游戏交流；及福瑞 以下内容也可交流： 个人日常，随笔分享（不要泄露自己的个人信息！） 我们不接受以下内容： 可能的灰色地带；攻击性较高的言论；标签化他人的行为

目前服务器由我本人个人运营，服务器运行在Hetzner US Oregon上。 总运营成本： Hetzner 13.6USD/mo Azure TafficManager Cloudflare 也欢迎带资/提供技术支持/管理支持加入

总之，欢迎你的加入！（也喊上你的小伙伴吧！）
Short:
Hihihi!

这里是Hydrate Craft!

我们建立于2023/02/01，目标是成为中文Mastodon中，汇聚MC/技术/绘画等多种内容的，包容而友善的站点!
注册请详细阅读规则，并随后阅读关于本站以了解目标！

请认真阅读，这有助于塑造良好的讨论环境。', '禁止 以任何的形式发布 对任何群体的侮辱性、仇恨性言论，及违反社会公德与伦理的内容。
禁止 以非私密形式发布 未经核实的、易煽动情绪、易挑拨群体对立的内容。', '禁止 骚扰任何用户。
禁止 对任何用户发送带有不受欢迎的性暗示、令人感到不安的内容。', '涉及现实政治、宗教、民族、地域等的内容应在发布时带有敏感内容标签。（即CW，Content Warning）
且可见性应当仅限于非公开，关注者可见或更私密。', '不宜在工作场合浏览的内容（含有性暗示的内容等）应在发布时带有敏感内容标签/警告（即CW，Content Warning），还都应该使用恰当的CW标签描述，如：
该内容可能不适宜在公共场合浏览。
并且请将公开程度至少改为不列出或仅限关注者。否则可能会直接遭到警告，设置为敏感内容，隐藏或删除。', '如果您的账号产出大量（定义：接近半数或更多的时间）的不适宜在公众场合浏览的内容，或产出直接的成年限制级内容，请您将账号更改为锁嘟，需要手动批准申请，否则可能会遭到警告，直接设置为锁嘟，或暂时冻结。
', '一些您可能会用到的设置。
个人资料-外观下可以设置锁嘟。
首选项-其他下可以设置默认把媒体文件标为隐藏。
发送嘟文时，CW字样或警铃图样为内容警告，地球图样为可见性（即公开 非公开等）
#技巧 话题下有更多的使用技巧。
#更新 话题下有更新报告和投票。']

Description:
■gaydadonについて

gaydadonはゲイやバイの方がユーザーのマストドンのサーバーです。
ここでは安心して自己表現できる快適な環境を目指しています。

新しい友達を作ったり
趣味を共有したり
色々な方々と会話を楽しんだり

ぜひあなたも気軽に参加してみて下さい。

※ゲイ、バイ、以外の方のご登録はお薦めしません。


■マストドンはアプリでの利用がおすすめです
アプリ開始時に登録するサーバー名は「gaydadon.jp」と入力してください。（gaydadonはサーバー一覧からは選択できません。）
マストドン公式アプリ


■動画や画像を投稿する前に一読してほしいサイト http://qjira.jp/column/mosaic-retouching/


■各種表示
gaydadon【公式】
@gaydadonmaster@gaydadon.jp

Hostdon公式アカウント
@hostdon@mstdn.hostdon.jp
gaydadonはHostdon様のMastodonホスティングサービスにより運営されています。

白獅子(gaydadon運営の中の人)
@w_lion@gaydadon.jp


■運営について

gaydadon.jpは運営者「白獅子」が個人で設置しているサーバーです。

gaydadon.jpは、利用者がFediverseの活動拠点として本サービスを活用できるよう、快適で安定したサーバ環境を、持続的に提供することを目指しています。

gaydadon.jpは「Hostdon」のMastodonホスティングサービスを利用しています。アップデートやサーバーメンテナンスは全てHostdon様が行っています。メンテナンスや障害などの情報につきましてはHostdon公式サイトにてご確認ください。


■サーバーのルール

1.日本国内法を遵守して下さい。

2.公的秩序に反したもの、犯罪や薬物、あまりにも社会ルールを逸脱したもの、等の発信は禁止とします。

3.特定の個人を攻撃するような発言、差別的な発言やヘイトは禁止します。

4.投稿者において内容がセンシティブだと判断される場合、文章の投稿には「CW」、画像の投稿には「メディアを閲覧注意にする」を必ず設定してください。

5.モザイク処理していない猥褻な画像や動画の投稿はおやめ下さい。画像や動画にモザイク処理をする場合は、運営アカウントの固定ページにあるサンプルと同程度以上の強度としてください。また処理は「モザイクは可」、「ぼかしは不可」とします。

6.政治的な活動、宗教などの勧誘行為は禁止します。（話題として投稿をするのは良いです。）

※表示に相応しくないと判断した投稿を続けるアカウントは、告知無しでアカウントの停止を行う場合があります。


■サーバーの維持費と寄付

gaydadon.jpのサーバー維持費は、運営個人の出費により維持をしておりますので、どなたでも無料でご利用いただけます。

ただし、利用者の増加による負荷の増大、ホスティングサービス利用料金の上昇、運営者の経済事情の悪化、等により、維持が困難になる可能性もございます。

そこで利用者が寄付によるサービス維持への参加ができる方法を検討しております。窓口がご用意できました際には、ご賛同いただける方だけでかまいませんので、ご支援いただけますと大変嬉しいです。
Short: gaydadonはゲイやバイの方がユーザーのサーバーです。

Description:
Este servidor

Tú.social es un servidor de Mastodon para las personas del mundo tech español. Ya sea si trabajas en una startup o una multinacional, si eres CEO o becario, si haces soporte al usuario o eres desarrollador, en esta comunidad te abrazaremos.

Tú.social fue creado por un ex-ingeniero de Tuenti y es gestionado con la filosfia del software libre desde la infraestructura hasta el propio código de Mastodon.

En este servidor hablamos principalmente en español, y a veces en inglés, y hablamos de todo tipo de temas: desde los más tecnológicos (como el nuevo framework de nosequé) hasta los más cotidianos (sobre cómo hacer una tarta).

El guiño a la red social no solo es una cuestión de nostalgia, sino también el hecho de que la filosofía de Mastodon representa en cierta manera aquella maravillosa red social: tu feed son tus amigos, mientras que el feed federado son los amigos de amigos.

Servicios ofrecidos

Email forwarding

Al crear una cuenta de Mastodon en Tú.social automáticamente se cuenta una cuenta de correo con el mismo nombre, que hace la función de forwarding a la dirección con la cual el usuario se haya registrado.

Es decir si alguien con correo alguien@gmail.com se registra como usuario en este servidor, entonces los correos electrónicos enviados a usuario@tu.social llegarán a alguien@gmail.com.

Dependencia de servicios de terceros

Este servidor tratará de estar gestionada con la máxima transparencia, minimizando la dependencia de servicios de terceros cuya infraestructura no es software libre.

Es por ello que corre en un servidor dedicado en un k3s, en vez de un Kubernetes gestionado en la nube que Dios sabe como se ha desplegado.

Sin embargo, dado que los recursos son limitados, si que existe una dependencia en servicios de terceros cerrados que son:

  • Mailjet para enviar correos (un servidor SMTP del cual se podrá prescindir en el futuro desplegando uno propio)

  • Scaleway como Object Storage para alojar datos estáticos y guardar copias de seguridad. Es cierto que este servicio es privativo/cerrado, pero depender de un MinIO local dispararía mucho los costes actualmente.

  • Gitlab para alojar código fuente, como una alternativa más abierta (aunque no 100%) a Github.

Cuando haya que usar un servicio de tercero, este servidor preferirá siempre usar proveedores europeos, tanto fisica como fiscalmente.

Privacidad

Por favor, recuerda que los servidores de Mastodon no encriptan los mensajes enviados de forma privada, con lo que te recomendaría que nunca los usases para enviar información sensible (contraseñas, etc.). Haré lo que este en mis manos para proteger la integridad de esos datos, pero si no hay nada que proteger, todos estaremos más tranquilos.

Financiacion

Todo lo anterior es pagado por mi, @oleg, y mi intención es que el servicio siga siendo gratuito para siempre. Si éste creciera, tendría que usar una plataforma de donaciones tipo comprame-un-cafe para mantenerlo, pero mientras tanto el coste de la gestión de cuentas me supone más de lo que necesito conseguir, y mi intención no es lucrarme. Si me conoces personalmente, sigues pudiendo invitarme a una cerveza :)

Servidor en español para la gente del mundo tech.

Description:
General Information

AllThingsTech Wiki

AllThingsTech.social is a small Mastodon instance that anyone who is interested in all things tech related can call home. It's a safe place for anyone to talk about their passion for tech/technology, but also to post the things they wish to post and talk about on a daily basis.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. A number of instance blocks are implemented to comply with the principles of the covenant.

When AllThingsTech.social first launches, and for the foreseeable future, sign-ups will be limited and all users will have to be approved my staff before gaining access to the instance. This is being done to make sure everything runs as smoothly as possible, but to also ensure this instance remains a safe and friendly space for everyone.

If you'd like to get official updates about the server itself, you can do so by following this account: allthingstech@allthingstech.social

Admins And Moderators

Cliff - Admin
Kyle - Admin
Patrick - Moderator

Server Status Page

Server Status Page

Detailed Rules

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of AllThingsTech.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

  • Excessive advertising or self-promotion (including but not limited to crypto ponzi schemes or other MLM scams) without any other content.
  • Promoting things such as your livestream, YouTube videos, blog articles/reviews, etc. are acceptable as long as they abide by the above rule.
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources.
  • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions.
  • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.

    • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Racism or advocation of racism.
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism.
  • Casteism or advocation of casteism.
  • Transphobia, homophobia, discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof.
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism.
  • Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health.

    • The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Sexual depictions of children.
  • Content illegal in the United States or any other country.
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism.
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism.

    • Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

    • These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

    Most of our rules are forked from mas.to.

    New accounts that are created have 14 days from date of creation to update their profile to include a profile picture, a banner and a bio. Failure to do so will result in the account being deleted as to not fill up the server with inactive/dormant accounts.

    Donations

    If you would like to donate to help support the finances of AllThingsTech.social you are free to do so. Donations are not expected in any way, yet they are greatly appreciated!

    One-time or Recurring Donations

    Ko-Fi
Short: AllThingsTech.social is a Mastodon instance geared for those that love all things tech/technology.

Description:
詳しくは以下をご確認ください。

サーバールール

https://otadon.com/about

利用規約・プライバシーポリシー

https://otaku-social.com/tos.php

このサーバーについて

壁打ち専門サーバー「壁丼」です。
このサーバーではアカウント作成時、以下の設定となっています。

・フォロワーを手動承認に設定（鍵アカウント）
・フォロー、フォロワーのつながりを隠す
・公開範囲がフォロワー限定

また、ローカルタイムラインへのメニューが非表示になっています。
※API経由、URL直アクセスでは見ることができますが、デフォルトの公開範囲が「フォロワーのみ」となっているのであまり投稿を見ることができません。

各種表示

電気通信事業 届出番号 A-04-20240
Short:
壁打ち専門サーバーの壁丼です。
LTL（ローカルタイムライン）がなかったり、デフォルトで鍵アカウントや投稿範囲がフォロワー限定だったりと設定しなくても、公開範囲が限られているちょっと特殊なサーバーです。

Description:
Talk about books, track your reading, share it with your friends and manage your virtual shelf.

BookWyrm is ad-free, anti-corporate, and federated. You can seamlessly follow and interact with users on other BookWyrm instances, and on services like Mastodon. It is an amazing alternative for sites like Goodreads.

Welcome to this friendly instance by tchncs.de from germany. It is intended to be used in english and german language.

Description:
Admin contacts: @admin1@aoir.social and @admin2@aoir.social

AoIR Code of Conduct 0.6

Operation

The server is operated by @admin1@aoir.org and @admin2@aoir.org. The instance agrees to abide by the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Moderation

We currently have around a dozen moderators located around the world. Our goal is to respond to community concerns swiftly. The instance subscribes to fediverse-recognized blocklists, including Oliphaunt's Tier 0 List. The admin account follows #fediblock and other hashtags and will block or silence instances based on the advice of respected fediverse admins.

Funding

This server is funded by the Association of Internet Researchers, an academic association dedicated to the advancement of the cross-disciplinary field of Internet studies. It is a member-based support network promoting critical and scholarly Internet research independent from traditional disciplines and existing across academic borders. The association is international in scope.

Accounts on this server are available to dues-paying members of AOIR.

Code of Conduct

This is an instance for current members of the Association of Internet Researchers. Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Encouraged uses of AoIR.Social

If you are an AoIR member in good standing, and you are willing to engage with others respectfully, and you will respect our community's efforts to make this a safe space for queer, trans, Indigenous, BIPOC, and other structurally disadvantaged people, you are absolutely welcome here. While this instance is hosted by a scholarly association, sociability & posting about everyday life are just as welcome as professional networking, sharing research resources, and bragging about your publications.

First things first, please introduce yourself. After signing up, post a message to the Local Timeline telling us who you are, what your academic interests are, and helping us to get to know you better. Use the #introduction tag.

And after introducing yourself, feel free to:

  • Put your handle on the last slide of your conference presentations
  • Post a picture of your pets
  • Share your art and creativity
  • Engage in satire -- just must make a good-faith effort to punch up ("Punching up": making jokes or criticism at the expense of those with more power, higher status or greater privilege.)
  • Engage in activism
  • Recruit participants for academic surveys—formal, IRB-approved ones or even informal ones (just make sure to use content warnings so that others can consent and don't get too obnoxious about it; see below for more about research on AoIR.social)
  • Share what's going on in your day

Content Warnings (CW's)

One thing that differentiates Mastodon from other social media is the Content Warning affordance, which allows you to put a preview or warning about your post. This is useful for sensitive content, but can be used in other ways, too (e.g., jokes).

On AoIR.social, please add CW's (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • strong language,
  • rants,
  • selfies with eye contact,
  • current events (includes: US or non-US, local, national, international, and should be applied regardless of whether sources are academic or non-partisan), high-conflict or otherwise exhausting issues of popular debate (e.g. climate change, GMO's, privacy issues, elections, etc.),
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • photographs or illustrations of insects, genitals, wounds (even if they come from a scientific source)
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • sexually explicit content,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • stresses particular to academia such as grades, exams, thesis progress, academic job market prospects, and
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one. CWs are a courtesy to fellow AoIR.social members as well as the broader fediverse.

Image descriptions (alt-text)

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description. Here’s a guide on how and why to supply alt-text.

Unwelcome conduct on AoIR.Social

The following will result in: a warning from the admin or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice.

  • Providing unsolicited advice to strangers
  • Inappropriate un-CW'd posts on the Local Timeline (see above for CW policies)
  • Posts with un-described images or video
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or spruiking for cryptocurrencies, NFT's, or multi-level marketing schemes
  • Unrequested solicitations to join religious, political, or other ideologically-defined organizations

Exceptions:

DOI links (e.g. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.k959) are allowed but the post must accurately describe the title/author/journal to allow the reader to decide for themselves whether they would like to follow the link. (In cases of very long titles, you may truncate it, and in cases of long author lists, "First-Author et al" will do.) Posts with DOI links where the target of the link is not described, or not described sufficiently, may be deleted without warning.

Discussion of research about cryptocurrencies is of course allowed.

Things that will get your account closed, possibly without warning

  • Conduct that would violate the Association of Internet Researchers conference Code of Conduct, and specifically the following, which is adapted from the clause on harassment: “We do not tolerate harassment in any form. Harassment includes, but is not limited to, offensive comments related to characteristics such as gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion, technology choices. It also includes deliberate intimidation, stalking, and unwelcome sexual attention.” Violations can result in a permanent ban; you may not receive a prior warning.
  • Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others (e.g. falsely representing oneself as a member of a minority; services offering to write academic papers to help students cheat; vaccine denialism; predatory conferences or journals; overt pseudoscience such as flat-earther-ism etc.)
  • Anything that could be described as "spam"
  • illegal content, especially child exploitation images or sexually explicit materials posted without the subject's consent 
  • Impersonating other people
  • No bots and no "institutional" accounts operated by non-members please; AoIR.social is for people. The obvious exception is that the AoIR organization itself will post official communications here. Any official communications will be marked as such.
  • Accounts that automatically repeat a Twitter account, RSS feed, etc. must post to AoIR.social as Unlisted, not Public

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Members of AoIR.social are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race). Furthermore, the abuse of content moderation tools for targeted efforts to silence, smear, or otherwise harass any individual account holder, for any reason, will not be tolerated.

Use of AoIR.Social for research

Researchers who wish to study AoIR.social or our users by collecting data using the API or through any other means that does not involve an "opt-in" from individual users are required to submit their protocol, analysis plan and all relevant ethics approval documentation from their institutional review board or departmental internal review documentation by email to the AoIR Fediverse admin account. You may also be required to submit code you plan to execute so that it can be tested to ensure it does not degrade the quality of service to other users.

This does not apply to, e.g. surveys circulated on AoIR.social that individual users can consent to participating in. This does apply to database scraping software, or any means of recording user activity where our users might be surprised that they were included afterward, because they were not given a chance to consent.

AoIR is well known for being the leading organization developing ethical online research. Ethical research on this instance (and much of the fediverse) should be sensitive to the privacy expectations of its members. Many people came to the fediverse in order to avoid being included in unethical social media research, and so we place a higher value on conducting research on human subjects with informed consent than most other social media, in order to maintain high ethical standards.

At the admin's discretion, you may be asked to submit your research protocol, and the institution that is providing ethical review, even in the case that it is an opt-in survey. Failure to disclose your research plan may result in closure of your account, or having your network banned from our service.

Account Cancellation due to Lapsed Membership

If your AoIR membership has lapsed for longer than 1 year, you will be contacted about renewing your membership. If you choose not to renew, you will have 60 days to download your data. You may move your data to another Mastodon instance.

Version History

Version 0.1: Edited by AoIR Executive Committee in Google Docs

Version 0.2: Posted to AoIR.social, 20230312

Version 0.3: Edited after consultation with AoIR.org moderators, 20230325.

Version 0.4: Edited after second consultation with AoIR mods + aligning this COC with conference COC, 20230326.

Version 0.5: Edits to CW policy.

Version 0.6: Small edits, including adding @admin2 to the list.
Short: The Association of Internet Researchers is sponsoring this Mastodon server for its members. Members in good standing are welcome to join and have a home on the fediverse!

Description:
Welcome to radikal.social!

This Mastodon instance was created by a small group of activists that seeks to create a social media platform for the radical left in and around Denmark independent of the mainstream centralized and intensively surveilled platforms.

A digital space where we can share knowledge and ideas, spread propaganda, connect with each other, and reach new people on our own terms while being in control of our own data.

We are progressive, extra-parliamentary leftists fighting for a different and better world based on principles of freedom, equality and autonomy and without discrimination and oppression in all its forms.

We hope you want to join!

Guides

Are you new to Mastodon and the Fediverse? Here are some guides that might help you get started:

  • Mastodon in 180 seconds (English)
  • Mastodon help (English)
  • Mastodon quick start guide (English)
  • Fedi.dk (Danish)

Contact us

Modstand | they/them | @modstand | Danish, English

Mariehøne | she/they | @anarkokat | Danish, English

Doggo | they/them | @doggo | Swedish, Danish, English

Fraktal | he/him | @Fraktal | Danish, English

Sigurd | he/him/they/them | @siggi | Danish, Icelandic, English

Asbjørn | he/him/they/them | @a | Toki Pona, Danish, English, German

Code of Conduct

We expect everyone joining radikal.social to be aligned with the general goal of the instance as described above. At the same time, we realize that "the radical left" isn't a unanimous group and that disagreements and opposites exist within our movement.

Therefore we have specified how we moderate the instance here.

How we moderate

Every report is reviewed individually. We always initiate a dialogue with the reported account explaining why we think their behaviour is wrong and which actions we plan to take.

We differentiate between ignorance and malicious intent and want to give people the chance to learn and better themselves. If you have been reported we expect you to participate in the dialogue we initiate with you.

What we moderate

This is not a complete list of what we don't want on the server as such a list could never exist. Instead, we rely on trusting the reports we receive and listening to the people being harmed.

No discrimination, meaning:

  • No racism
    • No anti-blackness
    • No tone policing
    • No gaslighting BIPOC experiences
    • No cultural appropriation
    • No racial slurs (unless they are being reclaimed)
  • No sexism/femmephobia
    • No toxic masculinity
    • No sexist slurs (unless they are being reclaimed)
  • No trans- & queerphobia
    • Don't assume anyone's gender, pronouns or sexuality
    • Don't misgender or use deadnames
    • Limit gendered language
    • Don't "out" anyone
  • No ableism
    • Don't favour able-bodied/neurotypical people
    • Be aware of ableism in language and humour
  • No fatphobia
    • Don't use fat as an insult or skinny as a compliment
  • No bodyshaming
  • No classism
  • No xenophobia

No harassment in other forms:

  • No pornographic and/or sexualized images depicting people who did not consent to their image being shared
  • No threats of violence or incitement of violence towards any individual (including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm)
  • No stalking or doxxing
  • No continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • No purposeful misinformation
  • No spam

What we don't moderate

We prioritize marginalized people’s safety over privileged people’s comfort. This means that we will not act on reports regarding:

  • ‘Reverse’ -isms, including ‘reverse racism,’ ‘reverse sexism,’ and ‘cisphobia’ (because these things don’t exist)
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as “leave me alone,” “go away,” or “I’m not discussing this with you.”
  • Refusal to explain or debate social justice concepts
  • Communication in a ‘tone’ you don’t find congenial

Reporting

We rely on user reports to be able to moderate the instance. Reports should contain links, explanations, or other information that is relevant to the report.

A report does not guarantee the moderation response that you've requested. If reporting users are not satisfied with our decisions, we suggest using the Mute or Block functions.

We will do our best to follow up within a reasonable time frame.

Instructions on how to report a post can be found here.

Blocking & muting

We encourage users to make use of the block and mute options to help control what content appears on their timelines. While moderators will do our best to block bad offenders and defederate from toxic instances, we recognize that people have different limits and expectations of the fediverse, and these options allow for a more personalized experience.

Instructions on how to use personalized Block and Mute controls can be found here.

Content Warnings

Please use Mastodon's built-in Content Warning (CW) tool to label posts that other users may find upsetting. The following must always be labelled with a content warning:

  • Visual depictions of physical violence, blood, severe injuries, torture, murder, or medical procedures
  • Mentionings of suicide, self-harm, abuse, rape, or sexual assault
  • Pornographic content and detailings of sexual acts
  • Spoilers (within reason)

Accounts that regularly post these types of posts without Content Warnings may have their accounts silenced, or suspended, based on the severity of the behaviour, and may be asked by the moderators to migrate to another instance.

All users are encouraged to be considerate of others’ needs and preferences. Please listen and respect if someone asks you to label a post with a content warning.

Accessibility

We encourage the usage of captions and descriptive text when posting images, to make your posts more accessible to users who use screen readers.

For the same reason, we also discourage the usage of excessive emojis or unicode text symbols in posts or usernames.

Privacy

Posts on Mastodon are not end-to-end encrypted and IPs and other metadata are recorded when you use the site.

Therefore, radikal.social (as well as any other instance) should not be used to send sensitive information or post things you wouldn't post publicly anywhere else on the internet.

You have four different levels of publishing to choose from when posting. You can read about them here.

You can choose if you want to require follow requests and if you want your account to be suggested to others under your profile settings.

By default, your profile is indexed by search engines. You can change this in your settings here.

Read the full Privacy Policy here.

Who runs and moderates radikal.social?

As mentioned in the intro we are a group of activists who created the server. We are organized in a semi-open group and intend to keep a constant flow of people in and out of the moderation team to ensure a distribution of power and to keep the group representative of different positionalities.

If you are interested in becoming a part of the group feel free to reach out to us. Between 6-12 months (from March 2023) we will invite to an open meeting for every user on the server, where a new moderation team can be formed, and the future of the instance can be discussed.

As the moderation team, we are dedicated to keep improving our policy and moderation. We are accountable for the moderation we perform. Any feedback or criticism is very welcome!
Short: radikal.social was created by a group of activists to offer federated social media for the radical left in and around Denmark.

Description:
Pixelfed.art is a community-driven platform operated by @dansup (the creator of pixelfed) and is designed to showcase and celebrate various forms of visual art. This decentralized and federated platform offers artists a place to share their work, connect with other artists and enthusiasts, and build their online presence.

At its core, Pixelfed.art is all about art. Our community is designed to showcase images in the highest quality possible, providing a true-to-life representation of an artist's work. Artists can upload their art in various formats, including paintings, sculptures, drawings, photography, and digital art. They can also add descriptions and hashtags to their work to make it easier to discover and search for by other users.

Our platform allows for the creation of portfolio and collections, which can be used by artists to curate their work and showcase their personal style and aesthetic. Members can follow individual artists and accounts, and interact with them through comments, likes, and shares. This social aspect of our platform fosters a sense of community and allows users to connect with other artists and art enthusiasts from around the world.

In addition to showcasing individual artists, our community can also feature curated collections of art from different genres and styles, as well as exhibitions and showcases of work from emerging and established artists. This creates a diverse and inclusive environment where members can discover and appreciate different forms of art.

Pixelfed.art is fully decentralized, meaning that artists have complete control over their work and the way it is shared and distributed. This ensures that artists maintain ownership of their art and can protect their intellectual property. Our platform is also open-source, allowing developers to contribute to its development and ensuring that it remains a dynamic and innovative community for artists and art enthusiasts alike.
Short: Pixelfed.art is a community-driven platform designed to showcase and celebrate various forms of visual art.

Description: Furry focussed Pixelfed, a photo and image sharing platform with a decentralised and ethical approach! We welcome all furry or furry adjacent members here to share their photos or artwork (with attribution pls!) and will give you a grief free home away from anything nasty. If you are looking for other Furry related Fediverse sites, why not take a look at https://www.furryfediverse.org/
Short: Furry focussed Pixelfed, a photo and image sharing platform with a decentralised and ethical approach!

Description:
基于mastodon的果壳树洞致力于创建一个氛围友好、注重隐私、数据自主的非官方校内封闭平台，并保持这里是一个可以畅所欲言、氛围极其友善的温馨后花园。

在这里，你可以讨论不愿在公共平台上讨论的校内热点，也可以记录和分享校园生活，寻找同好。

我们不喜欢炒作和煽情，只想踏踏实实打造一个让大家用着舒服的平台。

建立本站的灵感来自于闭社，是一个分布式的高校平台联盟，已经陆陆续续有十余所海内外高校的独立团队自发加盟。每个站点都是由来自对应学校的的团队自主独立运营，使用自己的服务器和域名。在发布内容时，可以选择仅本站可见还是允许跨站。

本站仅支持mails.ucas.ac.cn或mails.ucas.edu.cn邮箱账号注册以保证后台实名以及本服务器所有成员均属于本校，但也说明每个人可以拥有两个账号。@hole@hole.ucas.icu账号作为bot账号自动转发私信承接树洞功能，只要您在消息最后加上 匿了 两个字就可以匿名发送消息。原则上任何人的信息不会被主动从数据库中拉取，除非您严重违反了社区规定。

本站目前完全由limesty@limesty.moe运营，无其他资金或技术来源。如果你也想参与建设这个站点，请采用电子邮件联系。
Short: 这里是果壳树洞（ver.社交网络）
rules: [{'id': '1', 'text': '禁止触碰政治话题，禁止发布色情内容，禁止对服务器成员进行恶意开盒等人身攻击'}, {'id': '2', 'text': '提倡就事论事的讨论，不提倡引战内容，多一些人文关怀'}, {'id': '3', 'text': '不允许将站内截图流传到公开的网络平台上'}]

Description:
Welcome to Techtoots:

An english Mastodon community focused around tech (any vintage!). We welcome technologists, coders, engineers, gadget lovers, self professed “geeks” and anyone with an interest and love of tech. If you share the opinion that the the best technologies are the ones that most resemble ‘magic’- you’ve found your home in the fediverse!

Social networking, back in your hands!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic—you decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the Community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little to defray the monthly costs of operating our instance. Any support is appreciate and completely voluntary - thanks for your consideration.

Patreon

Mastodon Server Covenant Commitment

We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  • Daily backups of user data.
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.

You can read more information here.
Short: An english Mastodon community focused around technology (any vintage!). We welcome technologists, coders, engineers, gadget lovers, self professed “geeks” and anyone with an interest and love of tech.

Description:
Ce serveur héberge une instance Mastodon, média de micro-blogging libre et décentralisé. Vous pouvez partager avec les autres membres, ainsi que les membres des autres instances, automatiquement. Bienvenue !

Cette instance à vocation éducative et pédagogique est destinée aux classes francophones (et leur.s enseignant.s) participant ou souhaitant participer aux projets proposés par l'association SCOllectif. Elle est également ouverte aux adhérents de l'association.

L'instance Mastodon SCOllectif est hébergée en France sur les serveurs de la société ZACLYS et elle est gérée par l'équipe de l'association SCOllectif.

Cet espace d'échanges vous est proposé gratuitement par l'association SCOllectif. Vous pouvez néanmoins nous aider via une adhésion ou un don

Description:

Babb.no is a instance dedicated mostly to Norwegian users, specially those connected to the University of Oslo, but join us if you want even if you don't fall into our target group.

Description:
A comfy, non-toxic, and inclusive Misskey/Sharkey Server for Anime/Manga/Japanese Media fans and Anime/Japanese Media Content Creators (Bloggers/Video Creators/Podcasters/etc.). Sister instance of sakurajima.moe.

Description: Federation.Network ist eine allgemeine deutschsprachige Instanz und (d)ein Einstieg in das Fediverse. Über das ActivityPub-Protokoll kannst du mit deinen Freunden auf Mastodon, Pixelfed, Lemmy & Co. kommunizieren, während du von Funktionen wie einem modernen und anpassbaren Interface, Emoji-Reaktionen, animierten Text-Posts bis zu 4000 Zeichen, Volltextsuche und vielem Weiteren profitierst.
Short: Federation.Network ist eine allgemeine deutschsprachige Instanz und (d)ein Einstieg in das Fediverse. Über das ActivityPub-Protokoll kannst du mit deinen Freunden auf Mastodon, Pixelfed, Lemmy & Co. kommunizieren, während du von Funktionen wie einem modernen und anpassbaren Interface, Emoji-Reaktionen, animierten Text-Posts bis zu 4000 Zeichen, Volltextsuche und vielem Weiteren profitierst.
